channel.id: Crime and Investigation Network HDTV (CI HD)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In London Road pawnbrokers in Sheffield, boss Dan Hatfield and his sister Cherise try to negotiate a deal on a tuk-tuk, and cobbler Peter is looking for a quick cash deal on some designer shoes and an antique clock. Meanwhile, at Pickwick pawnbrokers in London, Nathan Finch secures deals on a classic silver Clipper caravan, some war memorabilia and several designer luxury bags.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou has his work cut out sealing a deal with a pushy young entrepreneur who wants to borrow £100,000 against his Lamborghini, while there's a shock in store for film director Ken Russell's ex-wife Hetty when she brings in a collection of family photographs. A married couple become emotional as they look to pawn a large painting, a mum-of-three parts with her mother's diamond ring to support her kids, and long-term client Tauren risks losing his prized set of designer watches by falling behind on his loan repayments.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer head to Chelmsford, Essex, where they try to find a dream £1million house for internet entrepreneur Steve Clark and his wife Dee. A couple with a much more limited budget also seek help in finding a family home in the area.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Jeff Platt, the President and CEO of entertainment and fitness business Sky Zone, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win an action-adventure holiday. He aims to discover whether his fast-growing company is running as smoothly and efficiently as possible, but his secret identity is jeopardised when he encounters a colleague he has met on a previous occasion.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Kat Cole goes undercover among the workforce of her company Cinnabon Incorporated, which serves sweet treats from more than 900 bakeries in 40 countries worldwide. Kat has come a long way after being raised by a single mother who fed her family of three girls on $10 a week. She seeks advice from her old boss, former Hooters CEO Coby Brooks, who also went undercover, in his own organisation. Kat has some lofty goals for Cinnabon to become a worldwide food brand, and wants to make sure that the new products she has put in place are working before she implements her plans.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to The Lion Hotel in Pontypool for the third day of the contest, where manager Marc Harris and head chef Wayne Williams aim to deliver a high end service. Although some of the guests are impressed by the rooms, Ray and Fay find it too small for the price, and simmering tensions between some of the competitors leads to a clash over dinner. At breakfast, Wayne's food comes under fire, but it is David and Donna's feedback about finding a nail in their room that really rattles their hosts.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Banker Mandeep Rajput is keen to impress as he hosts the first dinner party in Dudley, West Midlands, joined by musical pensioner Di Dawson, quiz master Adam Reece, dog groomer Vicky Pell and businesswoman Sarah Freeman.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Pub quiz host Adam Reece takes charge of the second dinner party in Dudley, West Midlands, hoping his `mixed up' theme, Italian menu and game show-style entertainment will be enough to win him the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Pensioner Di Dawson hosts the third dinner party from Dudley, West Midlands, and hopes some good honest home cooking will impress the guests. However, the evening is overshadowed by Adam Reece's offensive humour and his flirtatious behaviour with dog groomer Vicky Pell.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog groomer Vicky Pell hosts a cruise ship-themed party for her guests in Dudley in the West Midlands, but Adam, whose smutty sense of humour has caused outrage all week, continues to behave badly. His actions eventually create a rift with Di, threatening to turn the evening sour.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businesswoman Sarah Freeman hosts the final dinner party from Dudley, West Midlands, and hopes to impress her guests with a Moroccan menu, but the simmering tension between rivals Adam Reece and Di Dawson threatens to jeopardise her chances of winning the £1,000 cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: The house-hunters are in the West Country, where Phil Spencer meets a couple who are looking to put down roots after years of moving around the country because of the husband's job in the RAF. Meanwhile, Kirstie Allsopp helps a newlywed couple who have £175,000 to spend on their first home. However, a chance encounter with a neighbour over a garden fence takes their search off in an entirely new direction.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman comes to the aid of Sue and Mike Bloomfield from Manchester, who with Mike's retirement around the corner want to buy a holiday home on the Algarve.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Schrodinger the cat is brought in with a shattered thighbone after being hit by a car, and Noel Fitzpatrick prepares to fuse the broken pieces back together in an all-night operation. Plus, English bulldog Lois is put on a strict diet and given an exercise regimen, and an elderly springer spaniel called Flossie, who has lost control of her back legs, arrives at the clinic.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A dachshund is brought in by owners Kelly and Daniel to see if anything can be done to repair a deformity in its foot, and Noel Fitzpatrick gives the one-year-old a lesson in doggy discipline along the way. A 10-month-old labrador needs a hip replacement before it can begin training as a medical-alert dog to help its owner with her rare health condition. An eight-year-old shih-tzu has the most extraordinary walk the vet has ever seen, but the operation to fix the dog's spine will be extremely risky, presenting the owners with an agonising decision.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of specialist letting agencies dealing with benefit tenants who have turned to private landlords. In Leeds, letting agent Aimee has received complaints about a bad smell and a high volume of bluebottles coming from one of her properties. For South Yorkshire agents Andrew and Allen, rent arrears have reached an all-time high, forcing them to come up with a controversial way to bring in more money.(n)

programme.title: Bear About the House: Living with My Supersized Pet
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the relationship between people and their exotic and potentially dangerous pets, including a seven-foot Russian bear who regularly has meals with his owners. Minnesota couple Mike and Valerie keep a one-ton buffalo that has to be showered in a car wash and goes on nights out to the local bar.(n)

programme.title: The 2,000,000 Calorie Buffet
programme.desc: Documentary about the growth in the number of all-you-can-eat restaurants offering limitless servings of food for a fixed price, featuring interview with diners who can eat four days of calories in one sitting and the canny restaurateurs who know every trick going to fill people up quickly. Narrated by Johnny Vegas.(n)

programme.title: The World's Weirdest Weather
programme.desc: Alex Beresford explores bizarre weather phenomena, including a flash flood in New Zealand that washed a dozen eels onto a suburban street, and a huge swarm of seemingly flying spiders in Brazil, powered by static electricity from a thunderstorm. Plus, a strange wave that submerged an entire town in Argentina, the barrel-shaped cloud that helps hang-gliders fly for hours on end, and a volcano in Hawaii that produces its own mini tornados.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Cameras follow Chester Zoo's four new fledgling Humboldt penguins who are being brought up apart from the main colony until they're old enough to compete for fish in the main pool. They're keen to make a break for it and join the adults, but when they're finally free to go they have other ideas. Elsewhere, Niall the chimpanzee keeper has known chimp Boris for 44 years. When the ape captures a moorhen chick, Niall must use his powers of persuasion to negotiate the safe release of his hostage.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: With numbers in the wild dwindling rapidly, Chester Zoo's black rhino breeding programme is a key part of preserving the species. Black rhino Kitani is introduced to new mate Magadi, but with injury a high risk during mating, keeper Babs is concerned that Kitani may struggle to defend herself, since she lost her horn after the death of her calf. Meanwhile, there's a surprise birth in the orangutan house, and older sibling Tuti has to fend for herself and set out on the road to independence.(n)

programme.title: Excluded at Seven
programme.desc: In 2017, record numbers of children are being permanently excluded from primary schools. Filmed over two terms at The Rosebery - a short stay school in Norfolk - this Cutting Edge documentary follows six excluded primary children who make up its youngest class.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawnbroker Dan is visited by renowned snooker player and commentator Willie Thorne who wants to do a deal on an original artwork, and a world champion Thai boxer hopes to pawn three of his championship belts. At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in south-east London, Nathan and assistant Deb test-drive an ice-cream van that owner Sam wishes to sell, and Tom has a diamond ring he wants to dispose of.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Staff are amazed by two diamond necklaces owned by very different clients, but Patrick suspects one of them could be fake upon closer inspection.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Reformed cat burglar Sid hopes to raise funds with help from his family and their jewellery, Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou gets the fright of his life when he test-drives a superbike at Brands Hatch race track, and new employee Kristen faces a challenge when she has to value two huge tanzanite stones. Office manager Jo visits Maggie, a client who can't pay back her loan following a string of bad luck. She's in danger of losing her late mother's jewellery - unless Jo can talk round shrewd businessman James.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer guide artist Zena Ellis as she takes her first step on to the housing ladder in Luton with a budget of £125,000. Also seeking assistance are new parents Lysan and Bo Cheng, who want to move out of London and return to Bedfordshire for a slower-paced family life, but find £550,000 doesn't go far in their chosen part of the country.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Kat Cole goes undercover among the workforce of her company Cinnabon Incorporated, which serves sweet treats from more than 900 bakeries in 40 countries worldwide. Kat has come a long way after being raised by a single mother who fed her family of three girls on $10 a week. She seeks advice from her old boss, former Hooters CEO Coby Brooks, who also went undercover, in his own organisation. Kat has some lofty goals for Cinnabon to become a worldwide food brand, and wants to make sure that the new products she has put in place are working before she implements her plans.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Stephen J Cloobeck, chairman and CEO of hotel company Diamond Resorts International, becomes the first boss to go incognito at his own organisation for a second time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final guest house of the week is the New Inn, Talgarth, where ex-naval officer Damon Lewis is the sole captain of his ship. Wayne and Marc are determined to be brutally honest, and Donna and David are forced to work closely with their rivals Fay and Ray during an afternoon team-building exercise. Over dinner, Damon admits that taking on the B&B, pub and restaurant all by himself may have not been the best decision - as proved when he has trouble running a solo breakfast service.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Health-conscious grandmother Tina Ainsworth hosts the first dinner party in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, putting on a Chinese-themed evening for her guests - croupier Tomasz Wisniewski, PR consultant Julia Smith, copy writer Rachel Imms and DJ Gareth Harding.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Croupier Tomasz Wisniewski hosts the second dinner party in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire. His `outrageous'-themed evening leaves plenty of scope for his guests' imaginations, but his balloon-pumping competition brings out the competitive streak in one contestant.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Gareth Harding hosts the third dinner party from Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, where he provides an Ibiza-themed night after he transforms his garden into a Balearic cocktail bar and club complete with lasers and disco lights. The guests seem impressed with the host's sophisticated menu, but he may have bitten off more than he can chew as he attempts to cook a tricky beef Wellington.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Animal lover Rachel Imms hosts the fourth party of the week from Mansfield. She opts for a French-themed evening, but her complicated main course proves to be a challenge, and her accordionist entertainer does not appeal to everyone in the way she had hoped.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dance fanatic Julia Smith hosts the final party in Mansfield, Nottinghamshire, and is confident she will wow fellow competitors with her fancy house and hospitality, having roped in two waiters to give the evening a touch of class. A spot of salsa dancing proves entertaining for all the wrong reasons, and as the event draws to a close, the contestants gather to discover which dinner was rated the best.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps firefighter James find a two-bedroom Victorian conversion in south-west London on an £180,000 budget. In the same location, Phil Spencer looks for a spacious property suitable for Steve and Eloise and their baby twin daughters, but needs to persuade the pair to compromise on the area if they are to find anything within their £330,000 limit.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps teachers Paul Gardner and Paula McKee hunt for the perfect property near Murcia, Spain, after the soon-to-be-wed pair both secured jobs at the nearby international school. The couple have set aside a budget of £200,000 for the relocation.(n)

programme.title: Craft It Yourself
programme.desc: New series. Clemency Green, Ant Anstead and Robin Johnson offer advice and ideas for home furnishings and decor. The first episode explores a Cuban theme while reviving an unloved dining room. Clem and Robin make a woven bench, Ant tries his hand at painting tiles while Robin tries his patience when he makes a beaded chandelier.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: With numbers in the wild dwindling rapidly, Chester Zoo's black rhino breeding programme is a key part of preserving the species. Black rhino Kitani is introduced to new mate Magadi, but with injury a high risk during mating, keeper Babs is concerned that Kitani may struggle to defend herself, since she lost her horn after the death of her calf. Meanwhile, there's a surprise birth in the orangutan house, and older sibling Tuti has to fend for herself and set out on the road to independence.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 80-year-old patient is admitted suffering from pain in her chest, arm and jaw, and consultant Sarah is concerned that Joan's heart is struggling and requests an urgent blood test and heart. Meanwhile a 26-year-old woman who fell and hit her head during a hen party in Ibiza complains about headaches, dizziness and vomiting, with doctors fearing she may have caused serious damage.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: The return of the programme following the emergency services, this time focusing on the work of the police, paramedics and fire service in Wiltshire. The first edition examines the rise in racially aggravated hate crimes, with the mother of a nine-year-old girl calling 999 to report that her daughter has been racially abused by two 11-year-olds while out playing. PC James Isaac arrests a 29-year-old man who targeted a 17-year-old white girl with text messages after coming across photos of her and her black boyfriend on Facebook.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 24-year-old beautician Gemma from West Sussex. She has dated a few love rats and is now searching for her Prince Charming. She is followed by 28-year-old bisexual tattoo artist Jennafer, who is fed up of men and now wants to find the perfect woman. Will any of the contestants be just what Jennafer is looking for?.(n)

programme.title: That '70s Show

Starring Kurtwood Smith, Mila Kunis and Topher Grace.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms

programme.title: That '70s Show

programme.title: When Celebrity Goes Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Contributors including Union J's Jaymi Hensley, Vanessa Feltz, Carole Malone, Adam Rickitt and Carol Decker recall the popstars, actors, comedians and even astronauts embroiled in everything from sex scandals to televised meltdowns. Unflattering episodes featured include Jimmy Carr's public shaming for tax avoidance, Naomi Campbell's blood diamond debacle, Justin Lee Collins's career-stopping harassment conviction and Leo Sayer's `clean pants' rant in the Celebrity Big Brother house. Plus, Dustin Diamond, of Saved by the Bell fame, reveals the truth behind his ill-judged sex tape and veteran newsreader Ed Mitchell describes how alcoholism left him homeless.(n)

programme.desc: Two black male FBI agents pose as white female debutantes in the line of duty, donning full drag and very heavy make-up in an audacious bid to infiltrate a kidnapping ring. Comedy, starring brothers Shawn and Marlon Wayans, with Jaime King and Frankie Faison.(n)

programme.title: The Revenant

programme.title: Scarface

programme.title: The Take
programme.desc: In this thrilling action flick set in Paris, a maverick CIA agent forges an unlikely bond with a pickpocket as they investigate a terrorist conspiracy targeting the city's Bastille Day celebrations(n)

programme.title: Semi-Pro
programme.desc: One-hit wonder Jackie Moon uses his musical earnings to buy a basketball team, but must fight to keep his side in the game(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: Return to the decade that taste forgot as Adam Sandler stars in this surprise smash comedy set amid the big hair, pastel shirts and relentlessly peppy pop of the 1980s. When one-time rock hopeful Robbie is jilted at the altar, he vents his bitterness in song, even when singing at other people's weddings! Only true love can redeem the broken hearted songster but fortunately, he's about to meet a woman who will spin him right round (like a record)(n)

programme.title: Head of State
programme.desc: When a presidential candidate dies unexpectedly in the middle of the campaign, the Democratic party unexpectedly picks a Washington, D.C. alderman, Mays Gilliam, as his replacement(n)

programme.title: Sisters
programme.desc: Two daffy adult sisters throw one last raging party in their childhood home before it's sold by their parents, with disastrous results(n)

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: A sexy thriller about divers who find themselves battling sharks and ruthless criminals after discovering hidden treasure and a crashed plane loaded with cocaine(n)

programme.title: Dog Day Afternoon
programme.desc: Heist drama telling the true story of a man who holds up a Brooklyn bank to raise money for his lover's sex-change operation and becomes the focus of the entire city's attention(n)

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: In this actioner, Gene Hackman plays the renegade New York narcotics detective Popeye Doyle. Based on the true story of officers Eddie Egan and Sony Grosso, it is an account of how Doyle and his partner exposed the largest, most lucrative heroin-smuggling ring in the world(n)

programme.title: Hereafter
programme.desc: Three people dealing with their own experience of the afterlife find their lives intertwining(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: Student Peter Parker develops superhuman strength after he's bitten by a laboratory spider. He starts to hit back against the school bullies, and then takes the fight against crime into the city(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve a New York cop goes to Los Angeles to visit his estranged wife at her company's Christmas party, held on the top floor of a huge skyscraper. The building is invaded by terrorists, leaving the cop, who's escaped to the roof, as the other partygoers' only hope for survival(n)

programme.title: Fantastic Four
programme.desc: A brilliant scientist builds a device that allows users to teleport to an alternate dimension, but an experiment involving it goes wrong and leaves him and his three teammates with unusual superpowers. The quartet are then forced to work together to battle an enemy from their past(n)

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: A biography of of Scottish playwright JM Barrie, whose relationship with a young widow and her sons inspired the children's classic "Peter Pan"(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: "Mad Max" sequel about survival in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Mel GIbson, Bruce Spence. Wez: Vernon Wells. Feral Kid: Emil Minty. Pappagallo: Mike Preston. Humungus: Kjell Nilsson. Warrior Woman: Virginia Hey. Curmudgeon: Syd Heylen. George Miller directed(n)

programme.title: High Anxiety
programme.desc: (1977) Mel Brooks' love of parodying film genres ( Young Frankenstein, Blazing Saddles ) continued with this affectionate spoof of Hitchcock's films, including Psycho, North by Northwest and Vertigo . Brooks plays Dr Richard H Thorndyke, new chief of the Psychoneurotic Institute for the Very, Very Nervous. There are mysterious disappearances, attempts on his life and scary Nurse Diesel (Cloris Leachman), whose closet is full of whips, as the gags fuel the delightfully crazy plot. Edited for language(n)

programme.title: Ghost World
programme.desc: Thora Birch ("American Beauty") stars in this funny and bittersweet coming-of-age film about a cynical high-school graduate whose outlook changes when she strikes up a friendship with a socially inept, fortysomething record collector (Steve Buscemi). The film is based on the graphic novel by co-screenwriter Daniel Clowes. Scarlett Johansson, Brad Renfro, Illeana Douglas, Bob Balaban, Teri Garr(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: This utterly chilling horror film centers on a young woman who must protect her brother from a terrifying apparition that only manifests in total darkness. Later, she realizes that this fearsome entity is connected to her mentally ill mother, who has started hallucinating conversations with a mysterious figure named Diana(n)

programme.title: Trapped
programme.desc: When their daughter is abducted and taken for ransom by a gang of serial kidnappers, a young doctor and his wife find themselves held hostage while a 24-hour plan to extort their money is set into motion. Now, with time running out they find themselves in a life-and-death race against the clock as the "perfect crime" begins spiraling towards an unthinkable, terrifying and deadly conclusion(n)

programme.title: By the Sea
programme.desc: In 1970s France, a former dancer (Angelina Jolie-Pitt) and her writer husband (Brad Pitt) attempt to rebuild their crumbling marriage by taking an extended vacation to a small coastal town, where they bond with its quirky inhabitants. As he struggles with writer's block and she with her emotional turmoil stemming from their troubled relationship, they try to remember what brought them together fourteen years prior. This film marks the first time in ten years that Angelina Jolie-Pitt and Brad Pitt have starred together, since the 2005 film Mr. and Mrs. Smith. Jolie-Pitt is also the writer and director of the film(n)

programme.title: To Be or Not to Be
programme.desc: A very funny remake of Ernst Lubitsch's classic 1942 black comedy about actors who turn spies in World War II Warsaw. A theatre troupe are unwittingly embroiled in the Polish Resistance via a young freedom fighter who is carrying on an affair with the leading lady. The thespians soon get involved in thwarting the occupying Nazis and saving the rest of the movement when their theatre is closed and they lose their luxury home(n)

programme.title: Role Models
programme.desc: After getting arrested, drinks salesmen Danny and Wheeler are forced to mentor two troubled kids. But who's learning from whom?(n)

programme.title: Baby Mama

programme.desc: Newly divorced Kathy wanted the entire first floor of her condo renovated, and hired contractor Randy to do the remodelling. But all she got for the $8,000 she paid was a load of appliances in the living room, a dangerous fireplace, and a host of excuses. Adam Carolla and Skip assess the damage while Alison tracks Randy down and confronts him about his unfinished and shoddy work.(n)

programme.desc: An angry woman who blames her former daughter-in-law's new husband for her son's death hires a hitman to exact retribution. Briscoe and Curtis manage to get their hands on the contract killer but fail to understand why his customer has gone to such extreme lengths.(n)

It appears that the victim had been smuggling contraband goods in his truck and the detectives believe that the killers had their sights set on retrieving a shipment of drugs from the vehicle - but the illegal cargo is not what the CSIs or the criminals expect. Crime drama, with Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.desc: The detectives probe the shooting of a motorist, and arrest a man who helped the victim change a tyre on his car shortly before he was killed. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Benjamin Bratt.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Curtis investigate the death of a book editor who was reputedly having an affair with one of her authors, and find themselves focusing on the lover's long-time companion, whose alibi turns out to be a tissue of lies. Police drama, starring Sam Waterston and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Three women dressed identically as the Breakfast at Tiffany's character Holly Golightly rob a jewellery store and kill a salesman in the process, triggering an inquiry that leads the team into the murky world of illicit diamond trading. Meanwhile, Mac and Peyton investigate the discovery of a mummified corpse in a condemned building. Forensic drama, starring Gary Sinise.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The driver of a Ferrari is gunned down by a motorcyclist and the victim is identified as petty officer Colin Boxer, who was holding down a second job as a valet parker and had borrowed the sports car. The owner of the vehicle turns out to be Vijay Chaya, the billionaire head of a large corporation, and the team suspects a case of mistaken identity. During the course of the investigation, Gibbs chances on a medal awarded to Leroy Jethro Moore, the man he was named after and an estranged friend of his father. Guest starring Billy Dee Williams (The Empire Strikes Back) and Ralph Waite (The Waltons).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. First lieutenant Michael Torres gets involved in a fight before falling to the ground, and is found beaten to death the next morning. The only witness is his friend and colleague Captain Joe Westcott, who suffers from post-traumatic stress disorder and has trouble distinguishing reality from his past military experiences in the Middle East.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.desc: Benson and Stabler investigate a rape case involving a girl and her older sister's boyfriend, but when questioned, the suspect claims he committed the crime in his sleep. Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay and Christopher Meloni.(n)

Huang's suggestion that a personality disorder drew her to the youngster is undermined by incriminating evidence that casts new light on the case. Guest starring Melissa Joan Hart (Sabrina the Teenage Witch).(n)

programme.desc: Teenager Lydia Wade manages to escape a gang of masked men trying to abduct her and her friend Rosie, the daughter of a US Navy commander. DiNozzo and McGee find links on Rosie's laptop to possible suspect John `Diesel' Stevens.(n)

programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Sheepdog trainers and farmers Shirley from Lancashire and John from Yorkshire compete alongside man's best friend in the Nidderdale Agricultural Show's Sheepdog Trials.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Officers in Amsterdam find a Liverpool drugs baron, while the Metropolitan police are hunting down two American brothers who fled the US while awaiting trial. In West Yorkshire, PC Dave Lockwood and PC Tom Allen are on the hunt for a Polish man, accused of theft and fraud.(n)

programme.title: Wild Alaska Live
programme.desc: Steve Backshall, Matt Baker and Liz Bonnin report on the Alaskan wildlife as bears, eagles and orcas gather for one of nature's greatest spectacles, the Alaskan summer feast. Elsewhere in the programme, Steve attempts to land on a glacier by helicopter, Liz has an encounter with some of the largest brown bears in the world, and Matt takes to the skies to view orca and humpback whales feeding.(n)

programme.title: A Prescription for Murder
programme.desc: With exclusive access to psychiatric reports, police footage and drug company data, reporter Shelley Jofre investigates the mass killings at the 2012 premiere of a Batman film in Aurora, Colorado. James Holmes, a 24-year-old PhD student with no record of violence, murdered 12 people and injured 70 others. Could the SSRI anti-depressants he had been prescribed play a part in the killings? This programme explores the devastating side effects of being prescribed SSRI anti-depressants, that might lead to psychosis, violence, and even mass murder.(n)

programme.title: Room 101 - Extra Storage
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel show presented by Frank Skinner, with Catherine Tate, Rylan Clark-Neal and Nigel Havers competing to have their pet hates consigned to Room 101, with topics including 'hipster' restaurants, set up paparazzi shoots and politicians.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Secrets
programme.desc: A look at the retailers' attempts to outdo one another in terms of convenience - one of the fastest-growing battlegrounds. Gregg Wallace discovers how supermarkets decide where to open small stores, while Babita Sharma travels to Spain on the trail of easy peel fruit. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather.(n)

programme.title: Wild UK
programme.desc: The wildlife of the mountains, finding out about ravens, the golden eagles of the Scottish hills and asking whether the UK will ever again play host to a long-lost beast - the lynx.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Lucy Alexander explore a substantial building in Kent that has been divided into flats along with a three-bedroom house, small workshops in Derbyshire and a one-bedroom flat in Surrey. All of the buildings are being sold at auction and are in need of modernisation, and the presenters talk to the new owners about their renovation plans after the sales, before checking on their progress a few months later.(n)

programme.title: Food: Truth or Scare
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford and Chris Bavin try to settle the age-old argument of whether tea and coffee are good or bad for the health. Plus, whether reusing plastic bottles is a bad idea.(n)

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville report on the apparently growing problem of bedbugs, in hotels and on planes. Plus, the dangers of jellyfish.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley helps a couple wanting to relocate from the coast to the Herefordshire countryside on a budget of £330,000. Plus, the presenter finds out about a mobile cider press.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore salvages a rusty drill press, a post-war chair and some wooden blocks from being discarded in Walsall, and attempts to make a profit through renovating them.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: At Gloucester Cathedral, presenter Paul Martin and experts Philip Serrell and Michael Baggott unearth some unusual items among the antiques and collectibles brought along to the valuation day. Philllip discovers there are still bargains to be found at car boot sales, and an exquisite Italian micromosaic necklace sparks Michael's interest. Meanwhile, Paul fulfils a lifetime's dream when he runs away to Gloucester-based circus, Giffords, and learns a few tricks of the trade from its famous clown, Tweedy.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Clive, Hilary and Rebecca from the south-west of England and Welsh farmer Barbara are hoping to win prizes for their best pigs at the Dorset County Show.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: A smug Max makes things worse for an oblivious Lauren, while Carmel turns to Denise for support when she unexpectedly receives divorce papers from Umar. Sonia discovers Dot has been overcharged for multiple bills, but the stubborn pensioner refuses to accept any help, and Derek is touched by Johnny's latest actions.(n)

programme.title: Watchdog
programme.desc: Matt Allwright, Steph McGovern and Nikki Fox ask whether airlines are breaking new rules designed to ensure delayed passengers get what they are entitled to, and test out cleanliness and hygiene standards on trains. Rogue Traders exposes a business whose tactics may be breaking the law.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Comedian and actor Adil Ray is the latest celebrity uncovering facts about his heritage in the genealogy documentary. The Citizen Kahn star's mother came to England from newly independent Kenya in 1967, and now he identifies himself as Muslim, Pakistani, African and Brummie. Adil heads to east Africa to find out more about his lineage, tracing his mixed Asian and African ancestry across Kenya to Uganda, meeting relatives for the first time in the traditional kingdom of Buganda and investigating a rumoured link to royalty.(n)

programme.title: One Deadly Weekend in America
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of a single July weekend in the US when seven young people were shot. Told through the stories of survivors, witnesses, families and law enforcement agencies, as well as newsreels, CCTV and police videos, the film paints a dramatic portrait of America's troubling relationship with guns.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: John Hannah reminisces with Brian Conley about The Sweeney and The Champions, and recalls how his big break in gritty drama Brond led to subsequent big screen roles.(n)

programme.title: Wild UK
programme.desc: Zoologist Lucy Cooke and wildlife cameraman Colin Stafford-Johnson explore the nation's forests, and see how the pine marten in Scotland is helping animals in Wales.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The North West chefs go all out to impress with their main courses, as they compete for a chance to cook at the Taste of Summer banquet. Paul Askew creates a dish based on his mother's favourite food, Ellis Barrie offers up an imaginative course inspired by former Wimbledon champion Fred Perry, and Tom Parker presents his take on a traditional summer barbecue.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs Ellis Barrie, Tom Parker and Paul Askew continue the battle to cook at a Taste of Summer banquet celebrating 140 years of the Wimbledon Championships. As each of them prepare their desserts, they will all be out to impress as only two can make it through to tomorrow's North West final.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Tom Heap investigates a global food shortage on the horizon, and questions if Britain still has what it takes to meet the challenges of the future.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner visit Mersea Island in Essex to learn about its culinary traditions and heritage. The pair chat to an oyster farmer whose family has been farming the same beds for decades and Brian cooks the shellfish for Janet to sample. He then meets fellow chef Darren Bennett at the Magic Mushroom where he serves up a meal of local trout before meeting pigs that produce prize-winning sausages. Meanwhile, Janet explores the history and geography of Cudmore Grove's unspoilt stretch of coastline.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of homemade meals to sate cravings for a takeaway, including fish and chips from James Martin and a pizza recipe from Keith Floyd.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: The family's first few weeks running a safari camp in a rugged outpost on northern Kenya's frontier has been a rollercoaster ride, but now the real test begins. The rainy season hits Samburu National Reserve and as a rogue flash flood hits camp, Saba Douglas-Hamilton races to protect the camp and the animals, while an elephant and its calf get into trouble.(n)

programme.title: Super Senses: The Secret Power of Animals
programme.desc: The concluding episode explores the world of scent and examines the animals that have pushed their sense of smell far beyond human capabilities. In the Bahamas, physicist Helen Czerski dives into shark-infested waters with only a small pouch of liquid as her defence against them, while biologist Patrick Aryee controls the behaviour of a swarm of bees by using tiny traces of scent, and gets uncomfortably close to a skunk.(n)

programme.title: Live Swimming: World Championships
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents coverage of day four from Danube Arena in Budapest, Hungary, which will include the final of the women's 200m freestyle discipline, as well as the men's 200m butterfly event. With expert analysis from Rebecca Adlington and Mark Foster. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Mel Giedroyc, as pairs of contestants go head-to-head to crack a series of passwords, in an attempt to take home £2,500 in cash.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Two famous faces from the world of stage and television, Ruth Madoc and Su Pollard, head out on the road to Congleton, Cheshire, to go antique hunting with Phil Serrell and Raj Bisram. Ruth finds out more about a famous 19th-century nurse, and Su visits the ancient Roman town of Caerleon.(n)

programme.title: The Sweet Makers
programme.sub-title: The Sweet Makers: A Georgian Treat.
programme.desc: Four modern confectioners use original recipes, equipment and ingredients to recreate the extravagant displays of a Georgian confectionery shop. Guided by food historian Dr Annie Gray and social historian Emma Dabiri, the foursome travel to Bath to experience first-hand the life of confectioners in late 18th and early 19th-century England. The sweet-makers craft everything from towering jellies made from boiled calves feet, glasses of Parmesan ice cream, and a final course featuring an edible landscape.(n)

programme.title: Against the Law
programme.desc: Fact-based drama based on the 1954 Montagu Trial, in which gay journalist Peter Wildeblood and his friends Lord Montagu and Michael Pitt-Rivers were tried for homosexual offences. The ensuing scandal and public outcry over the fairness of the case forced a reluctant government to set up a committee to investigate whether homosexuality should be legalised. Starring Daniel Mays and Mark Gatiss and featuring testimony from gay men who lived through those days, a retired police officer and a former psychiatric nurse.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Cleverman
programme.desc: Slade tries to bring Koen and Waruu into his grand plans for the Hairypeople and while Latani is still free, Djukara and Araluen continue their ordeal in prison.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Choreographer and Strictly judge Craig Revel Horwood becomes the latest celebrity to dig into his family's past in the popular genealogy show. Having lived and worked in Britain for the past 26 years, he now returns to his native Australia, curious to know if anyone else in the family was also involved in showbusiness. He discovers that one ancestor risked everything in the Australian gold rush, before a visit to his 100-year-old grandmother puts him on the trail of another maverick relative, who was the life and soul of the party. Sound like anyone we know?.(n)

programme.title: Incredible Medicine: Dr Weston's Casebook
programme.desc: Surgeon Gabriel Weston investigates the most complex and mysterious part of the human body, the brain, meeting with extraordinary people with seemingly superhuman abilities. Dr Weston meets Derek, a man who was suddenly able to play piano after a head injury, and Paul, who has a hereditary genetic condition which means he can't feel pain. This episode also explores the recent developments in technology that allow doctors to identify if patients who they believe to be in a vegetative state are in fact conscious and aware.(n)

programme.desc: The two remaining North West chefs compete for a place in the national finals, preparing their entire menus for judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest judge Greg Rusedski. Greg, a former British number one tennis player, understands the high standards expected at his sport's Grand Slam contests, in this Wimbledon-themed series.(n)

programme.desc: The first of the North East heats sees returning champion Tommy Banks and newcomers Danny Parker and Josh Overington prepare their starters. Tommy draws inspiration from the traditional celebration of midsummer, Danny creates a dish using 22 vegetables, while Josh's centres on a savoury strawberry veloute.(n)

programme.title: A Taste of Britain
programme.desc: Janet Street-Porter and Brian Turner explore the cuisine and culture of Gloucestershire, beginning in Crickley Hill, where a barefoot forager teaches them about the culinary secrets of the woodland. The pair then follow in the footsteps of one of Britain's most notable composers by taking the Holst Walk through the Cotswold countryside, before they encounter some very happy Gloucester Old Spot pigs at Todenham Manor Farm.(n)

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott serves up a seafood special and his catches of the day include a fish pie from Mary Berry, a crab and leek tart from the Hairy Bikers, Nigel Slater's mackerel and bacon salad, a lobster dish from James Martin and Lorraine Pascale's fish and chips.(n)

programme.title: This Wild Life
programme.desc: Wildlife expert Saba Douglas Hamilton and the elephant rescue team race to save the life of a recently orphaned calf. The baby elephant is flown to an elephant orphanage in Nairobi, but with a terror threat on the Kenya's East coast, the family's safari camp is also in crisis. Saba must work to save the business and do all she can to protect Samburu's trusting elephants.(n)

programme.title: Hive Alive
programme.desc: Part one of two. Naturalist and Springwatch presenter Chris Packham and journalist and beekeeping enthusiast Martha Kearney are joined by Professor Adam Hart to explore the remarkable secrets of the lives and habits of bees. Midsummer is a critical time for the insects as they must gather enough food for the winter, so a specially designed hive equipped with an array of cutting-edge technology is used to monitor them and find out how they do it. The team also puts the latest scientific findings about bees to the test.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.sub-title: Natural World: Chimps of the Lost Gorge.
programme.desc: Documentary providing an insight into the lives of chimpanzees in Uganda's Kyambura Gorge, a deep, forested ravine running through the African savannah. For 15 years, the gorge has been cut off from the rest of the jungle, leaving the animals stranded with limited sources of food. The programme follows the 20 remaining chimps as alpha male Brutus tries to retain control of the family in its daily struggle to survive.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team return to Chenies Manor, near Amersham in Buckinghamshire, where members of the public bring along treasured antiques and collectibles. A young woman chooses a 21st birthday present from a collection of pocket watches kept in a biscuit tin and a train set that has been in its box for 70 years finally sees the light of day. Fiona reads a letter from a soldier to be opened in the event of his death, the relatives of a glassblower pay a moving tribute to their father's work and the update feature focuses on an ornate French plant stand first seen on the show in 1991.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Letterbox
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts the game show in which pairs of contestants go head to head attempting to crack a series of passwords, in a bid to win £2,500.(n)

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antonio Carluccio and Gennaro Contaldo search for bargains in East Anglia, with experts David Harper and James Braxton to assist them. Antonio learns about the brave fishermen of Suffolk who saved mariners' lives while risking their own and Gennaro takes a trip to see a very special bird.(n)

programme.title: 10 Puppies and Us
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following young dogs and their new owners over the course of their all-important first six months together. The first episode features Chihuahua Chloe, setting up residence in an east London nail salon. She immediately wants to befriend 10-year-old Rocky, formerly top dog in the household, but Rocky is not interested. Meanwhile, border collie Jura joins a ski patroller in the highlands of Scotland, rescue pup Pedro arrives in the Surrey countryside from Spain and golden retriever Lola joins Hampshire family the Payes.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Lake
programme.sub-title: Top of the Lake: China Girl: China Girl.
programme.desc: New series. Elizabeth Moss returns in this follow-up to Jane Campion's 2013 crime drama. Detective Robin Griffin is back in Sydney, eager to throw herself into her work, while secretly planning to search for the daughter she gave up for adoption. However, when a suitcase containing the body of a young woman washes up on Bondi Beach, Robin and her new partner Miranda begin an investigation that leads them into the dark side of Sydney's sex industry - with reverberations they could never have imagined. Nicole Kidman and Gwendoline Christie co-star.(n)

programme.title: The Mash Report
programme.desc: Comedian Nish Kumar presents the satirical and surreal take on the week's news, with a team of correspondents keeping viewers up to date with everything that has happened - or not happened - this week.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark.(n)

programme.title: Cleverman
programme.desc: After Slade tries to capture Koen and Kora by force, Waruu challenges Koen to use his powers, save the Hairypeople and confront the Namorrodor before it is too late.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Royal Welsh Show
programme.desc: Kate Humble celebrates the Welsh Cob as the horses take to the main ring, and also looks to the future of farming, from high-tech equipment to the next generation of farmers. Elsewhere in the programme, comedian Omar Hamdi finds out what happens when the public leave the show ground, and Gareth Wyn Jones tries to stay impartial at the international sheep shearing competition.(n)

programme.title: Norman Wisdom: His Story
programme.desc: The life and career of the comedy actor, told by those who knew him well, from his son, daughter and daughter-in-law to famous friends including Stephen Frears, Ricky Tomlinson, Leslie Phillips, Honor Blackman and Vera Lynn.(n)

programme.title: Hyper Evolution: Rise of the Robots
programme.desc: Professor Danielle George MBE and Dr Ben Garrod explore whether the rise of robots will enhance the progress of humanity, or ultimately threaten our survival. In the first episode, the pair uncover the obsession with robots in human form, and visit the fearsome Eric, the UK's first robot, to gain an understanding of the deep distrust towards robots inherent in Western culture.(n)

programme.title: Mechanical Marvels: Clockwork Dreams
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the history of the self-operating contraptions known as automata, which were first designed hundreds of years ago but display levels of technical sophistication that continue to amaze many today. Professor Simon Schaffer examines the history behind these clockwork motor-powered machines and the hardship endured by the workers that built them. Travelling around Europe, he visits a functional automaton city, observes a robotic boy that can be programmed to write, and witnesses a device capable of playing chess.(n)

programme.title: The Renaissance Unchained
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak examines the surprising climax of the Renaissance, a period full of war, confusion and darkness, which was captured perfectly in the art of Leonardo, Bosch, Arcimboldo, Palissy, the Italian mannerists and El Greco. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Tails You Win: The Science of Chance
programme.desc: Professor David Spiegelhalter tries to get to grips with chance and how it works. He tackles such questions as whether people are wise to take an umbrella when they go out, to ways of maximising the chances of living to 100, as he tries to establish if luck and fate are embedded in the fabric of the universe. Along the way, he discovers hidden patterns and shapes in a book written exclusively with numbers and explains why going sky-diving only marginally increases his risk of dying sooner rather than later.(n)

programme.title: Voyages of Discovery
programme.desc: Paul Rose visits Ecuador to examine the tale of an 18th-century expedition in which a group of French intellectuals set out to determine the shape of the Earth. The mission was beset by problems from the start as disease, disputes and affairs set the explorers on separate paths and, while great discoveries were made, the team was still to face theft, death and despair.(n)

programme.title: Mechanical Marvels: Clockwork Dreams
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the history of the self-operating contraptions known as automata, which were first designed hundreds of years ago but display levels of technical sophistication that continue to amaze many today. Professor Simon Schaffer examines the history behind these clockwork motor-powered machines and the hardship endured by the workers that built them. Travelling around Europe, he visits a functional automaton city, observes a robotic boy that can be programmed to write, and witnesses a device capable of playing chess.(n)

programme.title: Hyper Evolution: Rise of the Robots
programme.desc: Professor Danielle George MBE and Dr Ben Garrod explore whether the rise of robots will enhance the progress of humanity, or ultimately threaten our survival. In the first episode, the pair uncover the obsession with robots in human form, and visit the fearsome Eric, the UK's first robot, to gain an understanding of the deep distrust towards robots inherent in Western culture.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Royal Welsh Show
programme.desc: Kate Humble meets up with the blacksmiths and Gareth Wyn Jones gets to grips with the fast-paced mounted games and looks at some of his livestock favourites. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Shipwrecks: Britain's Sunken History
programme.desc: Maritime historian Dr Sam Willis charts the stories behind the shipwrecks of the Georgian age, when Britain's naval fleet was considered the most powerful in the world. He learns how mutinous sailors, rebellious slaves and murderous wreckers threatened to undermine the country's dominance at sea at a time when it was establishing key colonies and acquiring new territories.(n)

programme.title: Prejudice and Pride: The People's History of LGBTQ Britain
programme.desc: The first of a two-part documentary in which people share the items that have defined their lives in the 50 years since homosexuality was partially decriminalised in 1967. They include a rare collection of the first openly gay magazine - featuring the rising young singer David Bowie - to letters from worried parents of newly `out' daughters and sons. Presented by Stephen K Amos and Susan Calman. Part of the Gay Britannia season.(n)

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Thanks to the advent of rail, moving produce around at speed suddenly became possible, allowing fresh meat, wet fish, dairy, fruit and vegetables to be widely available. With a new system of rapid transport it was now possible for London to enjoy food supplies from all corners of the nation. As Liz McIvor reveals, Victorian men and women developed a taste for one particular dish that would be popular with the masses for generations to come - fish and chips.(n)

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining class divisions on trains, with separate carriages for first, second and third class passengers. Over time, trains acted as a catalyst, with people travelling to regions and places for the first time, as well as changing the nation's relationship with royalty and developing a stronger sense of shared identity and culture. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Oak Tree: Nature's Greatest Survivor
programme.desc: George McGavin explores one of the great icons of the British countryside - the oak tree. Studying a 400-year-old tree throughout the different seasons of the year, George investigates its surprisingly sophisticated biology, how it adapts to its ever-changing environment and why it has become such an important part of the countryside.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.sub-title: I Never Cheered for My Father.
programme.desc: Will learns his parents are back together and has to explain the situation to a distraught Tina. Meanwhile, Elliot announces he wants to be a cheerleader - and proud father Jack resolves to help him achieve his dream.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Will takes on the task of helping Jack with his graduation speech for nursing school. Unfortunately, he gets completely carried away in his attempts to write something creative and insightful. American sitcom, starring Eric McCormack and Sean Hayes.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray reluctantly agrees to take Robert out on the town - but makes the mistake of revealing that the evening was not his idea, causing relations between them to nosedive.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray tries to teach Ally a lesson by resuming the piano lessons he gave up 25 years earlier - and finds himself wondering why he ever stopped receiving tuition in the first place. Comedy, starring Ray Romano.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink goes all out to win when he and Roz are nominated for a radio award, but wishes he hadn't after he discovers he is up against a veteran talk-show host who is retiring. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin is furious to learn Frasier has thrown out his favourite chair to make space for a new one, and sends him out to retrieve it. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: As the advancing years begin to take their toll on Frasier, he wonders whether a relationship with a 20-year-old sales assistant would help him recapture some of his youthful vitality. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Stephen J Cloobeck, chairman and CEO of hotel company Diamond Resorts International, becomes the first boss to go incognito at his own organisation for a second time.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer inadvertently saves Springfield from the consequences of a nuclear meltdown and becomes a local hero, but soon starts to feel like a fraud and grows tired of everyone congratulating him. Featuring the guest voices of `Magic' Johnson and Jon Lovitz.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Krusty's father disowns him for becoming a comedian - much to the dismay of Lisa and Bart, who promptly try to bring about a reconciliation between the two stubborn men. With the guest voice of Jackie Mason.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary
programme.desc: Includes news headlines, sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ben and Ambika kick off the competition in Hertfordshire with a south-east Asian menu. Their guests are Sinead from Northern Ireland and her prank-loving partner Tony, and competitive couple Kally and Mark. The lads bond over football, and by the end of the night Tony has played a prank or two setting the tone for the week. Subsequently, Kally and Mark put on an Anglo-Indian menu, but things soon get heated in the kitchen. Then, Tony and Sinead serve up an Irish menu, with silly dances, silly jokes and silly accents. However, it remains to be seen which couple will pocket the prize for best soiree.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Reformed cat burglar Sid hopes to raise funds with help from his family and their jewellery, Prestige Pawnbrokers boss James Constantinou gets the fright of his life when he test-drives a superbike at Brands Hatch race track, and new employee Kristen faces a challenge when she has to value two huge tanzanite stones. Office manager Jo visits Maggie, a client who can't pay back her loan following a string of bad luck. She's in danger of losing her late mother's jewellery - unless Jo can talk round shrewd businessman James.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with comedian Jenny Eclair in Dictionary Corner alongside Susie Dent.(n)

programme.title: The Question Jury
programme.desc: Game show in which seven contestants must work together while locked in a jury room. One juror has not slept a wink, with the rest of the jury room raring to go.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Retired couple Stephen and Janis Pigeon from Buckinghamshire want to make a permanent move to the western Costa del Sol, with a budget of £150,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Nigel and Pok U Regan hope to impress their fellow hoteliers with their east-meets-west atmosphere at Bingham Townhouse, a B&B and Cantonese restaurant in Nottinghamshire.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third host of the week in Windsor is outspoken entrepreneur Mohinder, who hopes to impress his fellow guests with an ambitious menu featuring tulips and a cauliflower foam.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Krusty learns he has a long-lost daughter, but ruins any chances of a happy family life by gambling away her most prized possession in a high-stakes poker game. Featuring the guest voices of Drew Barrymore, John Updike, Amy Tam and Stephen King.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Warren tells Grace his true feelings while Alfie and Tom tease Hunter. Elsewhere, Prince is keen to make his relationship with Lily work, and Darren lies to Nancy about his whereabouts.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Michel Roux Jr is joined around the tasting table by First Dates maitre d' Fred Sirieix, food writer William Sitwell, baker and deli owner Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander to put tea, croissants and barbecue pork ribs to the test. The quickfire public taste challenge involves rice pudding.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Kate Quilton heads to Chile to look into coloured crisps and find out how these rainbow snacks get their colour. Meanwhile, Jimmy Doherty travels to Spain to investigate one of the trendiest items on our shelves, avocados, and the rapidly rising demand for these fruits which is leading to alarming reports of a crime wave hitting growers.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: An 80-year-old patient is admitted suffering from pain in her chest, arm and jaw, and consultant Sarah is concerned that Joan's heart is struggling and requests an urgent blood test and heart. Meanwhile a 26-year-old woman who fell and hit her head during a hen party in Ibiza complains about headaches, dizziness and vomiting, with doctors fearing she may have caused serious damage.(n)

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: Kate and Wills visit Charles's traditionalist new town, Poundbury in Dorset, where Charles is unveiling another statue of himself. Pippa ponders whether she should leave her fiance Johnny, after she learns that he has lost his fortune and has become a pizza delivery man. Meanwhile, Kate runs into old flame Gypsy Ricky, who reminds her they are still married following a traditional gypsy ritual. Will Camilla use this to destroy Kate in her latest plan to grab power? Starring Harry Enfield, Louise Ford and Hugh Skinner.(n)

programme.title: Fargo
programme.desc: Emmit sits down with Gloria, while Nikki negotiates a deal. Starring Ewan McGregor, Carrie Coon, Mary Elizabeth Winstead and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: The return of the programme following the emergency services, this time focusing on the work of the police, paramedics and fire service in Wiltshire. The first edition examines the rise in racially aggravated hate crimes, with the mother of a nine-year-old girl calling 999 to report that her daughter has been racially abused by two 11-year-olds while out playing. PC James Isaac arrests a 29-year-old man who targeted a 17-year-old white girl with text messages after coming across photos of her and her black boyfriend on Facebook.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: First-time parents Rochalla and her unflappable partner Craig arrive 10 days overdue. Her shock pregnancy defied medical odds as she conceived just weeks after an aggressive course of chemotherapy. Cameras also follow train driver Kieron and his wife Joanne, who find it hard to kick their clockwatching habit during labour. While self-confessed ladies' man Michael and partner Natalia prepare for the arrival of her fourth child.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Pipestone, Minnesota, where he checks in to Historic Calumet Inn. Joint owners Vanda and Rina Smrkovski were given the hotel as a gift by their father, but after just nine months in charge, their staff are on the brink of revolt, and guests are expressing their dissatisfaction with the accommodation. Gordon quickly realises the sisters need to grow up fast if he's going to have a chance of saving the business. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Hope Springs
programme.desc: A middle-aged married woman feels her long-standing relationship with her unadventurous husband is becoming stale. When she hears of a marriage counsellor offering therapy sessions in his remote retreat, she persuades her reluctant spouse to join her for a week with the doctor rediscovering why they fell in love in the first place. Romantic comedy, with Meryl Streep, Tommy Lee Jones and Steve Carell.(n)

programme.title: Escape to Costa Rica
programme.desc: Science writer Gaia Vince concludes her tour of the most environmentally sustainable country in the world by going horse riding with a 99-year-old cowboy and taking a canoe trip to meet the indigenous Bribri people. She also sees thousands of olive ridley turtles coming ashore to lay their eggs. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp visits the Nidderdale agricultural show in the Yorkshire Dales, where she learns how to make her own pork pies and sausages. However, her success jeopardised by problems the evening before the event.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

programme.title: Countdown

First in a two-part series finale, also guest starring John Cleese, Tim Curry and Harry Connick Jr.(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
programme.desc: Part two of two. Rosario causes a stir on the dance floor, while Will tries to persuade Leo to tell Grace the truth. Lyle's eloquent speech at the reception does not receive the response he anticipated from Karen, and Jack is stunned by an offer from Jennifer Lopez. Guest starring John Cleese, Harry Connick Jr and Tim Curry.(n)

programme.desc: Ray tricks Debra into letting him play golf - but finds it difficult to put a good round together as he contends with a guilty conscience. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton.(n)

programme.desc: Ray is shocked to discover his parents planned to divorce when he was a child, and only stayed together to help him recover from an accident. Tormented by the thought they have never really been happy together, he begins to blame himself for all the misery in their marriage.(n)

programme.title: Frasier

programme.desc: Food critic Gil takes over the radio show to cover for an ailing Frasier - who immediately fears his job is under threat and resolves to get back on air without delay. Comedy, starring Edward Hibbert and Kelsey Grammer.(n)

Featuring the guest voice of James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer buys Lisa a pony in a bid to prove his love for her, but the family cannot afford the gift. To make ends meet and pay for the animal's upkeep, he is forced to take on a second job at the Kwik-E-Mart.(n)

programme.desc: In north Devon, married couple Frankie and husband Jason kick off the competition. Outspoken duo Kate and Ian don't let the evening's many delays go unnoticed, and as tensions rise around the table, internet lovebirds Chris and Amy try to stay firmly out of the way. Day two sees Kate and Ian serve up a menu full of rustic French cuisine, influenced by their 22 years living in France. But a table laying mishap suggests that Kate has overtly snubbed her guests, although tensions are eased when former falconers Kate and Ian bring out one of their favourite birds of prey. Finally it's dog lovers Chris and Amy's turn to step up to the plate, and believing themselves to be the foodies of the group they're confident they can bag the prize for best soiree.(n)

programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: Portugal v England.
programme.desc: Portugal v England (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the concluding match in Group D for both sides, which takes place at Koning Willem II Stadion in Tilburg, Netherlands. England's record in this tournament since the turn of the century leaves a lot to be desired, and while they did finish as runners-up in 2009, at the other tournaments staged in 2001, 2005 and 2013 they failed to progress to the knockout stage on any occasion, and had a combined record of one win, two draws and six losses. Tonight's match will be followed by highlights of Scotland v Spain. Presented by Clare Balding, with expert analysis from Jermaine Jenas, Eniola Aluko and Kim Little. This documentary celebrates the Dirty Dancing phenomenon, revisiting favourite scenes, discovering what happened on set - with contributions from cast members Kelly Bishop, Lonny Price and Jane Brucker - and hearing from the behind-the-scenes team, including choreographer Miranda Garrison and writer Eleanor Bergstein.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: Engineer Rob Bell sets out on a journey to discover how six of Britain's most stunning bridges were designed and built. Completed in 1890, the Forth Rail Bridge now carries around 200 trains every day. The last of the great Victorian engineering triumphs, it has grown to symbolise Scotland as much as Edinburgh Castle, bagpipes or kilts. But, as Rob learns, this incredible engineering achievement was born from the tragedy of the 1879 Tay Bridge disaster, and 73 deaths were connected with its construction and immediate aftermath.(n)

programme.desc: England v South Africa. Highlights of the opening day's play in the Third Test of the four-match series, which took place at The Oval in London. This will be the 100th Test match to take place at the famous ground, which becomes only the fourth in the world to host a century, alongside Lord's, Sydney Cricket Ground and Melbourne Cricket Ground.(n)

programme.title: Nightmare Tenants, Slum Landlords
programme.desc: Cases include Wendy, who was left with rental arrears of almost £3,000 after renting a house out to a nightmare tenant. Steve from Birmingham Council's housing enforcement team investigates poor living conditions above a local shop. And in South London, lawyer Chris has to deal with his client's site which has been filled by nearly two dozen caravans and a mountain of rubbish.(n)

programme.title: Joanna Dennehy: Killing for Kicks
programme.desc: How did a Home Counties schoolgirl grow up to be a serial killer? This programme offers a profile of the murderer Joanna Dennehy, who stabbed three men to death in a two-week murder spree and dumped their bodies in ditches around Peterborough, including testimonies from those who knew her best, including the father of their two children.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
programme.desc: Daily round-up of highlights, revealing how the housemates are getting on under the all-seeing eye of Big Brother, featuring the latest tasks, games, arguments, laughs, diary room visits and bedroom chit-chat. Narrated by Marcus Bentley.(n)
