programme.title: 28 Days Later
programme.desc: Danny Boyle's horror film begins with animal activists releasing monkeys from a research laboratory, little knowing they carry a fatal virus, the 'rage'. Twenty-eight days later, bike courier Jim awakes from a traffic accident-induced coma to find London a deserted ruin, populated by the blood-seeking undead. Meeting up with the uninfected Selena, Frank and Hannah, they set off in Frank's taxi to Manchester, where a group of soldiers led by Major Henry West offer a safe haven. But after surviving the terrors of the journey, on arriving at the encampment, their troubles are just beginning..(n)

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: Explosive thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger as a rogue U.S. Marshal who, when framed for murder, must bring down the people responsible and clear his name(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: "Mad Max" sequel about survival in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Mel GIbson, Bruce Spence. Wez: Vernon Wells. Feral Kid: Emil Minty. Pappagallo: Mike Preston. Humungus: Kjell Nilsson. Warrior Woman: Virginia Hey. Curmudgeon: Syd Heylen. George Miller directed(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: This utterly chilling horror film centers on a young woman who must protect her brother from a terrifying apparition that only manifests in total darkness. Later, she realizes that this fearsome entity is connected to her mentally ill mother, who has started hallucinating conversations with a mysterious figure named Diana(n)

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Entertaining biopic of Michael "Eddie the Eagle" Edwards, whose participation in the 1988 Winter Olympics marked the first time a Brit had ever competed at ski jumping. Edwards trains for the sport with a former champ, and finds fame as a lovable loser who's just trying his best(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A common thief named Bek enlists the help of powerful god Horus in a quest to defeat Set, an evil god who has plunged a once peaceful Egypt into the darkness. The survival of mankind and the fate of his lover lies in the hands of the unlikely mortal hero(n)

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: Ripley awakens 57 years later in this sequel to 1979's "Alien", returning to the space colony where she first encountered a hideous, reptilian creature(n)

programme.title: The Informant!
programme.desc: This quirky thriller follows Mark Whitacre, who discovers that his company is involved in price-fixing and turns informant for the FBI. Convinced he'll be a hero, he wears a wire to gather the evidence needed to convict his bosses. Unfortunately, both the case and Whitacre's integrity are compromised when FBI agents discover that he isn't the saintly figure he made himself out to be(n)

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax
programme.desc: A neurologist (Jamie Dornan) investigates the case of a young boy who has somehow repeatedly cheated death (Aiden Longworth) after the youth survives yet another near-fatal accident on his ninth birthday. As the doctor becomes obsessed with this mystery, he also develops romantic feelings for the boy's mother (Sarah Gadon). Aaron Paul (Breaking Bad, The Path) co-stars(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: Randall "Memphis" Raines, a retired car thief, is drawn back into action when a crime lord threatens to whack Raines' brother unless the thief steals 50 top-model cars within 72 hours. Raines recruits a crew of fellow carjackers, including an old pro and an old flame, and the race is on(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: Hitman Arthur Bishop (Jason Statham) is forced to come out of retirement and commit three difficult assassinations in order to rescue his kidnapped lover (Jessica Alba). The hardest part: He must make all of the killings look like accidents. Tommy Lee Jones, and Michelle Yeoh co-star. Directed by Dennis Gansel(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Lone Survivor director Peter Berg helmed this docudrama about the Deepwater Horizon disaster, the 2010 oil-rig explosion in the Gulf of Mexico that resulted in the largest offshore oil spill in U.S. history. The film depicts the challenges that Mike Williams (Mark Wahlberg) and the rest of the rig's crew faced as they fought for survival. Kate Hudson, Kurt Russell, and John Malkovich co-star(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Comedian Andy Kaufman gave performances that were bizarre and difficult to categorize, in which he might do or say almost anything: show cartoons, impersonate Elvis Presley, play conga drums while singing children's songs, read aloud from The Great Gatsby, or take the audience out for milk and cookies. Written by Scott Alexander and Larry Karaszewski and directed by Milos Forman (the team behind The People vs. Larry Flynt (1996)), this biopic takes an in-depth look at Kaufman's life and art, with Jim Carrey as Kaufman, who could (and would) be any number of different people onstage: the quiet and childlike man, the little foreign guy, the overbearing showbiz "professional," the violently obnoxious wrestler, or the world's worst lounge singer. As Kaufman rose from comedy clubs to guest appearances on Saturday Night Live and a spot on the TV sitcom Taxi, his performances became more complex and dangerous -- so much so that when word got out in 1984 that he was suffering from lung cancer, many fans and associates thought it was just another bizarre stunt; the disease took his life later that year. Man on the Moon features Danny De Vito as Kaufman's manager George Shapiro, Courtney Love as his girlfriend Lynne Margulies, Paul Giamatti as his friend Bob Zmuda, and David Letterman, Judd Hirsch, Marilu Henner, Carol Kane, and Christopher Lloyd as themselves(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: A martial arts master uses a tournament to infiltrate the island fortress of a one-armed drug baron. Action(n)

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: A mysterious, superhuman assassin teams with a young woman to take down a major corporation plotting to use his genetic makeup to create a race of unstoppable killers(n)

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Every December, safecracker Willie takes a job as a department store Santa. Every Christmas Eve, he robs the store and makes off with a lucrative haul. But is his boozy lifestyle killing his criminal record?(n)

programme.title: Tetro
programme.desc: This involving drama stars Vincent Gallo as the title character, an ill-tempered, brooding poet living in Argentina, who is visited by his younger brother after a long estrangement during which the younger brother thought Tetro might be dead. The two discuss their troubled relationship with their composer father and attempt to find some common ground. Directed by Francis Ford Coppola(n)

programme.title: Ouija: Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In this horror sequel, a game of Ouija leads to supernatural activity. The youngest daughter of a widow is possessed by an evil spirit as the family goes through hell to try desperately to save her(n)

programme.title: Cursed
programme.desc: "Scream" director Wes Craven and writer Kevin Williamson reunite for this bloodcurdling chiller. It's the story of siblings (Christina Ricci, Jesse Eisenberg) who are bitten by a mysterious beast, then gradually turn into werewolves. Can they break the deadly curse? Scott Baio and Craig Kilborn have cameos. Joshua Jackson, Portia de Rossi, Shannon Elizabeth, Mya, Kristina Anapau(n)

programme.title: Alien 3
programme.desc: The spaceship Nostromo touches down on a desolate planet after answering a distress call. They leave empty-handed, but for the strange lifeform attached to crew member Kane's face... Shaving her head to avoid contamination, Ripley soon realizes that she and her fellow humans are not alone on the planet - but convincing the hardened prisoners and their wardens of that fact does not prove easy. Additionally, Ripley gradually begins to suspect that she herself has become the latest nest for a new alien embryo - and that she will have to make the ultimate sacrifice to kill it off(n)

programme.title: The Forest
programme.desc: A young woman searches for her twin sister in an infamous Japanese forest beneath Mount Fuji where lost souls go to commit suicide. With the help of an American guide, she treks into the heart of the mysterious woodland(n)

programme.title: The Revenant
programme.desc: In 1820s America, frontiersman Hugh Glass is betrayed and left for dead by his fur-trapping party after he is viciously attacked by a grizzly bear. However, Glass survives and sets out to seek revenge(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: Wade Wilson, a former mercenary, is tricked into volunteering as the subject of a bizarre experiment that gives him superhuman abilities. He becomes an antihero with a warped sense of humour and goes on a mission to hunt down the people who are responsible for his twisted condition(n)

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: In this hypnotic thriller, Arthur and Norma Lewis (James Marsden and Cameron Diaz) experience a crisis of conscience when they receive a mysterious box with a button inside that will grant them $1 million and kill a random person when pressed(n)

programme.title: Ouija: Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In this horror sequel, a game of Ouija leads to supernatural activity. The youngest daughter of a widow is possessed by an evil spirit as the family goes through hell to try desperately to save her(n)

programme.title: The Rookie
programme.desc: Nick Pulovski is a cop, presently assigned to the auto theft division. When he discovers that a man named Strom is the brains behind a major car theft and chop shop ring, he sees this as his opportunity to do something big. After his partner is killed, the case is then transferred to homicide, so he is taken off the case. And he is assigned a new partner, a cop who would prefer to play by the rules(n)

programme.title: The Signal
programme.desc: Three students seek a notorious hacker in the Nevada desert, and end up imprisoned in a high-tech government-research facility in this nightmarish sci-fi thriller(n)

programme.title: 28 Days Later
programme.desc: Danny Boyle's horror film begins with animal activists releasing monkeys from a research laboratory, little knowing they carry a fatal virus, the 'rage'. Twenty-eight days later, bike courier Jim awakes from a traffic accident-induced coma to find London a deserted ruin, populated by the blood-seeking undead. Meeting up with the uninfected Selena, Frank and Hannah, they set off in Frank's taxi to Manchester, where a group of soldiers led by Major Henry West offer a safe haven. But after surviving the terrors of the journey, on arriving at the encampment, their troubles are just beginning..(n)

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: Explosive thriller starring Arnold Schwarzenegger as a rogue U.S. Marshal who, when framed for murder, must bring down the people responsible and clear his name(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior
programme.desc: "Mad Max" sequel about survival in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Mel GIbson, Bruce Spence. Wez: Vernon Wells. Feral Kid: Emil Minty. Pappagallo: Mike Preston. Humungus: Kjell Nilsson. Warrior Woman: Virginia Hey. Curmudgeon: Syd Heylen. George Miller directed(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: This utterly chilling horror film centers on a young woman who must protect her brother from a terrifying apparition that only manifests in total darkness. Later, she realizes that this fearsome entity is connected to her mentally ill mother, who has started hallucinating conversations with a mysterious figure named Diana(n)

programme.title: Eddie the Eagle
programme.desc: Entertaining biopic of Michael "Eddie the Eagle" Edwards, whose participation in the 1988 Winter Olympics marked the first time a Brit had ever competed at ski jumping. Edwards trains for the sport with a former champ, and finds fame as a lovable loser who's just trying his best(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: A common thief named Bek enlists the help of powerful god Horus in a quest to defeat Set, an evil god who has plunged a once peaceful Egypt into the darkness. The survival of mankind and the fate of his lover lies in the hands of the unlikely mortal hero(n)

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: Ripley awakens 57 years later in this sequel to 1979's "Alien", returning to the space colony where she first encountered a hideous, reptilian creature(n)

programme.title: The Informant!
programme.desc: This quirky thriller follows Mark Whitacre, who discovers that his company is involved in price-fixing and turns informant for the FBI. Convinced he'll be a hero, he wears a wire to gather the evidence needed to convict his bosses. Unfortunately, both the case and Whitacre's integrity are compromised when FBI agents discover that he isn't the saintly figure he made himself out to be(n)

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax
programme.desc: A neurologist (Jamie Dornan) investigates the case of a young boy who has somehow repeatedly cheated death (Aiden Longworth) after the youth survives yet another near-fatal accident on his ninth birthday. As the doctor becomes obsessed with this mystery, he also develops romantic feelings for the boy's mother (Sarah Gadon). Aaron Paul (Breaking Bad, The Path) co-stars(n)

programme.title: Gone in 60 Seconds
programme.desc: Randall "Memphis" Raines, a retired car thief, is drawn back into action when a crime lord threatens to whack Raines' brother unless the thief steals 50 top-model cars within 72 hours. Raines recruits a crew of fellow carjackers, including an old pro and an old flame, and the race is on(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: Hitman Arthur Bishop (Jason Statham) is forced to come out of retirement and commit three difficult assassinations in order to rescue his kidnapped lover (Jessica Alba). The hardest part: He must make all of the killings look like accidents. Tommy Lee Jones, and Michelle Yeoh co-star. Directed by Dennis Gansel(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Lone Survivor director Peter Berg helmed this docudrama about the Deepwater Horizon disaster, the 2010 oil-rig explosion in the Gulf of Mexico that resulted in the largest offshore oil spill in U.S. history. The film depicts the challenges that Mike Williams (Mark Wahlberg) and the rest of the rig's crew faced as they fought for survival. Kate Hudson, Kurt Russell, and John Malkovich co-star(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Terrance and Phillip. The second season opener of Comedy Central's irreverent animated series South Park alienated many of the show's hardcore fans. Instead of finishing the cliffhanger left concerning the identity of Cartman's father, Trey Parker and Matt Stone fashioned a half-hour vehicle for those Canadian jokesters Terrance and Phillip; they go to Iraq to find Terrence's kidnapped daughter. Before the half hour wraps up, Canada, Celine Dion, and television censorship advocates all receive the kind of stinging blows South Park fans have come to expect. "Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus," originally aired April 1, 1998(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear

Richard Hammond asserts authority over the sand dunes of Abu Dhabi in the six-wheel-drive Mercedes-Benz G63 AMG 6x6, while James May defies his status as Captain Slow by blasting two Caterhams around the test track - the minimalist entry-level Seven 160 and the full-fat supercharged Seven 620R. programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.(n)

programme.desc: Murray struggles to get Adam interested in hockey, but he doesn't enjoy the sport and fakes enthusiasm to please his father. Beverly tries to help Erica prepare for her college entrance exams, but her plans threaten to backfire when she does the job too well.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly replaces Murray's favourite chair with a new one without consulting him first, causing him to go on the warpath. Adam becomes tired of being picked on during the bus ride to school, but soon comes to regret enlisting Barry to help fend off the bully.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Trouble arises when Amy learns that Sheldon has applied for a one-way mission to colonise Mars. Meanwhile, Leonard surprises Penny with a gift, and Raj decides to snoop around Emily's flat after she is called back to work during their evening together. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is upset when a magazine fails to mention him in an article about the paper he co-wrote with Sheldon. Meanwhile, a blackout at Mrs Wolowitz's home leads to a final family dinner in her honour. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Everyone arrives back from Ibiza and Neeta has a decision to make. Harry gets a letter that sends him spiralling out of control and Tegan tells Farrah more than she should.(n)

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: Flirting and competitiveness both head through the roof as the travellers build a prehistoric home, before Brendan takes them on a treasure hunt with a difference.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The comedy returns after its mid-season break. The gang hear all about one another's Christmas adventures, from Sheldon and Amy's terrible trip to Texas, to Howard and Bernadette's first days as parents.(n)

programme.title: Kevin Can Wait
programme.desc: Kevin is jealous when his brother Kyle starts to receive lots of attention for rescuing a cat - so he starts to boast about saving a man from choking. Comedy, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess thinks she has been spending too much time acting like Reagan. Aly tells Winston an embarrassing secret, while Schmidt and Cece try to make their new home more secure.(n)

programme.title: New Girl
programme.desc: Jess avoids her feelings for Nick by taking care of her dad in Portland, while Nick himself accompanies Reagan to a party, where he panics that they do not really know each other.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: The gang goes on the infamous sociology and geography field trip to Swanage, during which Neil tries his hardest to avoid the advances of over-friendly teacher Mr Kennedy. Meanwhile, Will takes a shine to new girl Lauren - but she is only interested in Simon. Comedy, starring Simon Bird.(n)

programme.title: The Inbetweeners
programme.desc: Will is unhappy about being forced by Mr Gilbert to take a work experience job at a garage due to a mix-up that sees Neil joining a newspaper. Meanwhile, Jay sorts out a placement for himself and Simon at his father's plant hire company. Starring Simon Bird and Blake Harrison.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard vows to be more self-assured around women, believing his problem attracting a girlfriend stems from a lack of confidence. An FBI agent interviews the gang to assess Howard's suitability for a team working on a new surveillance satellite. Guest starring Eliza Dushku.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends set up camp outside a cinema to get tickets for a new cut of Raiders of the Lost Ark - but find themselves resuming hostilities with Sheldon's old foe Wil Wheaton, the former Star Trek: The Next Generation actor. Meanwhile, Penny and Bernadette invite Amy to a sleepover.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Life in the tropical Atlantic, where everything from dolphins, manatees and whale sharks to sunbathing jellyfish thrive in the Caribbean's warm, sheltered waters, fringed by coral reefs and rich mangrove forests. But when extreme heat in Africa unleashes terrifying hurricanes, all hell breaks loose across the region.(n)

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: A look at some of the strangest dinosaurs, including the buck-toothed Exipdexipteryx, the four-winged Microraptor and the pot-bellied Nothronychus.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor goes angling in Brazil, where he fishes for deadly black piranhas in the Amazon river. He then heads to Rio Negro, where he encounters pink river dolphins, and goes to the remote fishing community of Jaraua as he sets out to catch the world's biggest freshwater fish, the 10ft-long pirarucu.(n)

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: An exploration of how invertebrates' production of silk 300 million years ago became their greatest invention. Stronger than a steel thread of the same diameter, the material is as pliable as elastic and employed by spiders for activities as diverse as courtship, catching prey and tending their young. David Attenborough reveals how some communal spiders create silken palaces rising 15m to 20m into the forest canopy.(n)

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.(n)

programme.desc: Life in the tropical Atlantic, where everything from dolphins, manatees and whale sharks to sunbathing jellyfish thrive in the Caribbean's warm, sheltered waters, fringed by coral reefs and rich mangrove forests. But when extreme heat in Africa unleashes terrifying hurricanes, all hell breaks loose across the region.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Predators and prey in the open oceans come under the scrutiny of David Attenborough. Marlin track down a shoal of sardines as a sei whale scoops up the leftovers, dolphins herd mackerel and attract the attention of a sailfish with the resonance of their sonar, and giant sunfish queue up to allow other species, including seagulls, to feed on their parasites.(n)

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: An exploration of how invertebrates' production of silk 300 million years ago became their greatest invention. Stronger than a steel thread of the same diameter, the material is as pliable as elastic and employed by spiders for activities as diverse as courtship, catching prey and tending their young. David Attenborough reveals how some communal spiders create silken palaces rising 15m to 20m into the forest canopy.(n)

programme.title: Planet Dinosaur
programme.desc: A look at some of the strangest dinosaurs, including the buck-toothed Exipdexipteryx, the four-winged Microraptor and the pot-bellied Nothronychus.(n)

programme.title: Countdown to a Catastrophe
programme.desc: Documentary on the causes and consequences of storms and hurricanes, and the increasing numbers of mysterious interactions identified between different natural phenomena.(n)

programme.title: Wild Ones
programme.desc: A look at venomous creatures, such as snakes, lizards and the octopus. Plus, the tiny toxin-wielding red-backed spider and the ferocious Sydney funnel web.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the region's islands, which are home to a vast array of extraordinary wildlife. The programme reveals how remote human communities native to the area are surrounded by harsh terrain and subjected to extreme weather conditions. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.(n)

programme.title: Dino Gangs
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dr Phil Currie goes on a quest to prove that Tyrannosaurus rex were more intelligent and far more dangerous than ever imagined, and that they hunted in deadly, killer packs. With his groundbreaking new findings and extensive research, the palaeontologist and dino hunter challenges the very foundations of traditional dinosaur theories.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Fishing with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor heads to the coast of west Africa, where he begins by hunting for the Atlantic sailfish. In Guinea-Bissau, he hauls out two red snappers and a bigeye jackfish, before landing himself a marbled grouper, renowned for being one of the tastiest fish to eat. The following morning, Robson visits a large wreck full of sea life, hoping to catch his first barracuda, but things do not go according to plan.(n)

programme.title: Life in the Undergrowth
programme.desc: David Attenborough turns his attention to the network of partnerships that invertebrates have developed with one another and with plants. He reveals how the fairy wasp, the world's smallest insect, flies underwater to inject its eggs into those of the water beetle. Footage also shows how the caterpillar of the blue butterfly smuggles its way into an ants' nest by mimicking the smell of their young.(n)

programme.title: South Pacific
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the region's islands, which are home to a vast array of extraordinary wildlife. The programme reveals how remote human communities native to the area are surrounded by harsh terrain and subjected to extreme weather conditions. Benedict Cumberbatch narrates.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.(n)

programme.title: Infinitely Polar Bear
programme.desc: In this heartwarming comedy-drama set in the 1970s, a bipolar man promises his estranged wife that he will care for their two young daughters while she attends business school in New York(n)

programme.title: Major League
programme.desc: A rollicking, irreverent baseball comedy that follows the fortunes of a misfit team of bungling amateurs and over-the- hill athletes and how they and their fans react when they find themselves in the middle of a totally unexpected winning streak(n)

programme.title: Sleeping with the Enemy
programme.desc: A battered wife is stalked by her abusive husband after faking her death to start a new life(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: Drama in which a Chicago teenager with a passion for music and dancing moves to a conservative Midwest town whose fundamentalist religious leader believes rock music is sinful. The newcomer is ostracised at first, but after getting the preacher's daughter on his side he shows the local kids what they are missing. Hit songs 'Footloose' and 'Let's Hear It for the Boy' from the soundtrack were Oscar-nominated(n)

programme.title: Galaxy Quest
programme.desc: Aliens ask the unemployed actors of a cancelled science-fiction series to help them win an intergalactic war in this comedy(n)

programme.title: Waiting to Exhale
programme.desc: Four women gather regularly to share their friendship and to relate stories about their relationships with the men who breeze in and out and their lives(n)

programme.title: Philadelphia
programme.desc: After a successful gay lawyer is fired from his prestigious law firm due to the fact that he has AIDS, he teams up with an attorney to sue the partners for discrimination(n)

programme.title: Sleeping with the Enemy
programme.desc: A battered wife is stalked by her abusive husband after faking her death to start a new life(n)

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: An enormous great white shark terrorises a summer resort town, where a police chief, a grizzled fisherman and an intrepid marine biologist realise they're "gonna need a bigger boat" to battle the bloodthirsty beast. An Oscar winner for sound, editing and John Williams's score(n)

programme.title: Jaws 2
programme.desc: Having recovered from the grisly events of four years ago, Amity Island is once again packed with tourists. Families are sailing in the bay and swimming off the beach, but when two divers and a water-skier go missing, the local police chief fears that he is about to relive his greatest nightmare(n)

programme.title: The Night Before
programme.desc: Three best friends reunite every Christmas Eve for a wild night of debauchery in New York City. Since they're getting older and have new responsibilities, they plan one last epic bash together and try to find their way into the biggest party in the city, the Nutcracka Ball(n)

programme.title: The Walk
programme.desc: In this drama based on a true story, tightrope walker Philippe Petit crosses back and forth between the Twin Towers in 1974. Petit works to accomplish this feat while dealing with logistical problems and the concern of his loved ones(n)

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: A TV weatherman finds himself endlessly reliving the same day when he travels to the small town of Punxsutawney(n)

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Emotions run wild in the mind of a little girl who is uprooted from her peaceful life in the Midwest and forced to move to San Francisco in this Pixar adventure from director Pete Docter (Up, Monsters Inc.). Young Riley was perfectly content with her life when her father landed a new job in San Francisco, and the family moved across the country. Now, as Riley prepares to navigate a new city and attend a new school, her emotional headquarters becomes a hot bed of activity. As Joy (voice of Amy Poehler) attempts to keep Riley feeling happy and positive about the move, other emotions like Fear (voice of Bill Hader), Anger (voice of Lewis Black), Disgust (voice of Mindy Kaling) and Sadness (Phyllis Smith) make the transition a bit more complicated(n)

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: A wealthy tycoon whose life is orderly and happy finds his household disrupted by the arrival of a young man called Joe Black. His daughter falls for the young man innocent of the fact that Joe is Death, visiting Earth to take the life of her father..(n)

programme.title: Mrs. Doubtfire
programme.desc: Warmhearted slapstick comedy by the director of 'Harry Potter' and 'Home Alone'. Robin Williams won a Golden Globe as a divorced actor posing as an elderly Scottish nanny in an attempt to get his children back. His disguise is so good, neither his ex (Sally Field) nor his kids recognise him, but they all love the eccentric 'widow'. So everyone is happy - until the mother's old boyfriend (Bond star Pierce Brosnan) reappears(n)

programme.title: Machine Gun Preacher
programme.desc: Gerard Butler stars in Marc Forster's violent, fact-based drama about a substance-addicted criminal who finds God and relocates to Sudan to offer his own idiosyncratic brand of Christian charity. The film initially portrays Sam Childers as being a far from nice man: a misogynistic biker whose life is steeped in crime, narcotics and violence, and who quickly returns to armed robbery almost as soon as he's released from jail. But while he was inside, his wife Lynn found Jesus, and, after Sam gets stabbed, she urges him to join her at church. Sam subsequently has his own Damascene moment and starts life afresh, founding his own (legitimate) construction company. Before long he has also built his own church. But it's only after a trip to Sudan, where he witnesses the devastation wrought by the marauding Lord's Resistance Army, that he truly becomes driven. Relocating to the African country, he sets up a faith-based centre to care for victims of the LRA's violence and rape. And also takes up arms to literally fight the good fight... Also starring Michael Shannon(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.sub-title: Mr Monk Goes to a Wedding.
programme.desc: Disher escorts Natalie to her brother's wedding at a prestigious hotel, where an attempt is made on his life. In a further bizarre twist, the official photographer is killed - so Stottlemeyer takes his place and mingles with the guests in a bid to catch the culprit. Guest starring Holland Taylor (Two and a Half Men), with Tony Shalhoub, Traylor Howard and Jason Gray-Stanford.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and Jane are called to a rock-climbing wall at a gym, where the dead body of Jeremy Reese is dangling in mid-air. They discover that the victim was a botanist working on a new strain of marijuana resistant to fungal infection. Some of the seeds had recently gone missing and Reese's bank statements show large deposits from a company registered in the Cayman Islands. Had he been trying to sell commercial secrets to a tobacco firm? Simon Baker stars.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon reopens the case of billionaire philanthropist Tommy Volker, a man she believes orchestrated the deaths of two people who were attempting to expose his shady dealings. However, her persistence doesn't sit well with Volker, who informs her that he knows more about her than she thinks. Meanwhile, Jane begins to investigate the murder of up-and-coming model Charlotte Coates, whose body was found outside the rehab centre she was attending. He soon unearths two prime suspects in the form of a fellow patient and Charlotte's counsellor. Drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The team goes in search of a missing child who could prove to be an invaluable witness in the detectives' long-standing attempt to bring billionaire businessman Tommy Volker to justice. A henchmen who is thought to know the youngster's whereabouts is brought in for questioning, but refuses to talk and later takes his own life, fearful of the repercussions that await him. Drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and the team investigate the discovery of three corpses in a barn that appear to have been there for more than 20 years - and Jane is distressed when he finds Red John's trademark smiley face daubed on one of the walls. A ring from the scene is traced to a man who went missing in 1987 and was a member of the Visualize cult run by Jane's old enemy Bret Stiles.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: The leader of a tour company escorting Chinese diplomats is found murdered, prompting Brenda and the team to examine the woman's business practices in their search for the killer.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda and the team battle the FBI to hold on to the case of a woman found dead at the bottom of a cliff - an accountant who was due to run an audit on the LAPD. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.sub-title: Till Death Do Us Part - Part One.

programme.sub-title: Till Death Do Us Part - Part Two.

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: DiNozzo investigates a murder at the military academy he once attended, after a murdered marine and alumni of the school is found clutching a photo of a current student. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team suspects Gibbs's arch-nemesis is behind an explosion at a summit on global terror. Meanwhile, a grief-stricken Fornell struggles to deal with the fatal shooting of his ex-wife. American drama, starring Mark Harmon, David McCallum, Pauley Perrette and Joe Spano.(n)

programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A US Navy lieutenant is murdered at the Defence Logistics Agency, while visitings the office of an admiral currently away at sea. As the team investigates the scene of the crime, they realise a rare painting found in the admiral's office is actually an elaborate fake placed there after the killing, replacing the stolen original. As the quest to locate the missing artwork gets under way, the agents realise they need the help of an expert. Luckily, Tony's con-artist father has returned to town, having broken up with his fiancee, and is on hand to provide expert advice as the hunt for the killer takes them into the shady world of the black market. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: The Gambler
programme.desc: In this remake of the James Caan 1974 vehicle The Gambler, an English professor (Mark Wahlberg) who is also a compulsive gambler finds that the only people who will have anything to do with him are those to whom he owes money. Wahlberg stars as Jim Bennett, a lecturer reeling from the death of his beloved grandfather (George Kennedy). His all-or-nothing personality gets him in debt for more than a quarter of a million dollars to the no-nonsense Mr. Lee (Alvin Ing), who runs an illegal gambling den. Jim attempts to play his way out of the hole by borrowing money from vicious criminal Neville Baraka (Michael Kenneth Williams), but his strategy backfires and leaves him owing the latter as well. His wealthy mother (Jessica Lange) initially refuses to give him any more money, which prompts Jim to make contact with Frank (John Goodman), a loan shark who offers to front him the cash he needs, but promises that failure to repay will lead to the death of his "bloodline." At the same time, Jim teaches a class of college kids about Shakespeare and Camus. His best student, Amy (Brie Larson), openly flirts with him, but he's also preoccupied with trying to get through to Lamar (Anthony Kelley), a star basketball player whom the university higher-ups want him to pass so he can continue to play(n)

programme.title: The Gambler
programme.desc: In this remake of the James Caan 1974 vehicle The Gambler, an English professor (Mark Wahlberg) who is also a compulsive gambler finds that the only people who will have anything to do with him are those to whom he owes money. Wahlberg stars as Jim Bennett, a lecturer reeling from the death of his beloved grandfather (George Kennedy). His all-or-nothing personality gets him in debt for more than a quarter of a million dollars to the no-nonsense Mr. Lee (Alvin Ing), who runs an illegal gambling den. Jim attempts to play his way out of the hole by borrowing money from vicious criminal Neville Baraka (Michael Kenneth Williams), but his strategy backfires and leaves him owing the latter as well. His wealthy mother (Jessica Lange) initially refuses to give him any more money, which prompts Jim to make contact with Frank (John Goodman), a loan shark who offers to front him the cash he needs, but promises that failure to repay will lead to the death of his "bloodline." At the same time, Jim teaches a class of college kids about Shakespeare and Camus. His best student, Amy (Brie Larson), openly flirts with him, but he's also preoccupied with trying to get through to Lamar (Anthony Kelley), a star basketball player whom the university higher-ups want him to pass so he can continue to play(n)

programme.title: Jack Reacher

programme.title: Looper
programme.desc: A hired gun from the future discovers that his greatest adversary is himself in this twisting sci-fi mindbender starring Bruce Willis and Joseph Gordon-Levitt, and directed by Rian Johnson (Brick, The Brothers Bloom). In the year 2047 time travel has yet to be invented. Thirty years later, however, it has. Though immediately outlawed, time-travel technology is quickly appropriated by the mob, and used to cleanly dispose of anyone deemed a threat. The process is simple: When the mob wants someone to disappear, they simply send them back to the year 2047, where an assassin known as a "looper" quickly carries out the hit, and disposes of the body. Joe Simmons (Gordon-Levitt) is one of the most respected loopers around. Each kill earns him a big payday, and he's got big plans to retire to France. Then, one day, as Joe patiently awaits the appearance of his next target near the edge of a remote corn field, he's shocked to come face-to-face with his future self (Bruce Willis). When the younger Joe hesitates, the older Joe makes a daring escape. Now, in order to avoid the wrath of his underworld boss (Jeff Daniels), young Joe must "close the loop" and kill his older counterpart. Meanwhile, the revelation that a powerful crime boss in the future has set the underworld ablaze pits the two Joes on a violent collision course, with the fate of a devoted mother (Emily Blunt) and her young son hanging in the balance. Paul Dano and Piper Perabo co-star(n)

programme.desc: Roger heads to Charleston, South Carolina for a traditional whole hog barbecue and low-country oyster roasts.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger heads to Napa Valley, California, for two unique pig roasts. In St Helena, chef John Fink makes one of his famous portable Cuban pig roasts with mojo seasoning.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A team helps restaurant owners who suspect their employees are not doing their jobs correctly.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The team discovers that the staff of a Los Angeles restaurant are using a street vendor to help them line their own pockets.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel meets Antonia, who is a wizard in the kitchen but struggles to manage the finances of her restaurant, 90 Park. Now she needs serious help to keep the business going.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Kent, owner of Uptown Billiards in Portland, believes the social media expert he hired to promote his restaurant isn't doing an adequate job. Charles sends in Mystery Diner Amber and discovers the customers are being hustled.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: When the owners of A La Carts Food Pavilion in Portland hear complaints from their tenants about the new manager, they contact Charles Stiles to investigate. Mystery Diners go undercover to see if the grievances are valid.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre Foods America
programme.sub-title: St Croix: Bull's Feet in Paradise.
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern discovers a melting pot full of surprises when he visits St Croix in the US Virgin Islands.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Robert Irvine heads to Oklahoma City to help the owners of Urban Roots. Although there is lots of potential, the food is thrown together and the staff are not pulling their weight.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The owner of a cafe in San Francisco asks the team to discover the truth behind rumour of unauthorised promotions being given by his new manager.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: At a French bistro in San Francisco, the staff are investigated after their boss receives complaints of rude behaviour.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares more tempting recipes, including blueberry coffee cake muffins and gravlax.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares a birthday party for a friend's dog.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten hosts a black and white supper, and cooks chicken hash, pain perdu and white truffles.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American chef and cookbook writer Ina Garten prepares lentil sausage soup and seafood stew.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Anna makes supper for the winemakers at Ravine Winery, including concord grape focaccia, roasted chicken with sweet potato stuffing, autumn celery root potato salad, and apple tart.(n)

programme.title: Anna Olson: Fresh
programme.desc: Anna Olson prepares snacks for a night in with the girls, including gyoza pork dumplings, wild rice risotto pockets with peppers and pumpkin seeds, and maple baked apple bites.(n)

programme.title: The Healthy Gourmet
programme.desc: Ezra and Julie create heart-healthy meals for a group of fire-fighters.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares lunch for her family, including spicy sausage dogs with curry and onion sauce, kicking coleslaw with mustard and horseradish dressing, and kiwi lime pie.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes falafel with a chipotle tahini dip served in a pitta, chicken and waffles with maple syrup and Bourbon sauce, and a tart with a store-bought shortcut.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares a care package to send to Alex, who is away at university, including brownie cookies, homemade cheddar crackers, spicy party mix and crazy chocolate bark.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: The Other Men In My Life.
programme.desc: Ree Drummond is sharing about the other men in her life, like her dad, brother, brother-in-law and father-in-law, and their favourite sweets.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four bakers compete against each other as they create cakes to celebrate the 50th anniversary of Charlie Brown's All-Stars!.(n)

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: Haylie is in New York City for an appearance on Larry King Now. She butters up the crew with deviled eggs, but will she impress Larry with asparagus and prosciutto crescent rolls?.(n)

programme.title: Real Girl's Kitchen
programme.desc: Haylie hosts the traditional Duff family crab boil, with help from her sister and mom. Over cooking, the sisters trade food stories of growing up in Texas.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver rustles up simple, seasonal dishes and demonstrates how to cook using home-grown potatoes. Among the dishes on the menu are Spanish omelette and a roast chicken tray bake with tomatoes. Outside in the garden, Brian shows how tasty spuds can be cultivated in the smallest of spaces.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver cooks using peppers and chillies. The menu includes a spicy pork goulash and an experimental dish of smoked salmon with a zingy salsa. He also joins Brian for a taste-test of the hottest chilli in the world - and it is the loyal gardener who keeps his cool.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mary Ann Gilchrist takes a chance by cooking a fish she does not like as she, Andy Beaumont and David Kelman prepare seafood courses. The contenders are vying to win a place in the regional final to get the chance to represent Wales at a banquet marking the 70th anniversary of D-Day.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mary Ann Gilchrist, David Kelman and Andy Beaumont go all-out to impress the mystery judge as they prepare main courses. The contenders are vying to represent Wales at a banquet in St Paul's Cathedral to mark the 70th anniversary of D-Day.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares four soups, starting with hamburger soup, before making tomato soup, one-pot wonder sausage, potato and kale soup, and spinach soup.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond stocks up on chicken breasts on a major bulk buy trip, for recipes such as Cobb salad, skillet chicken lasagna, Thai lettuce wraps, and chicken rice soup.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: Four cake artists create emoji-themed cakes, with Gedeon Maheux, co-founder of Iconfactory, on hand to judge their creations.(n)

programme.title: Chopped Junior
programme.desc: New series. The young chefs have to butcher and cook snakes in the appetiser round, but some may be too squeamish to let their skills shine through.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits south-east Atlanta, an area not usually visited by tourists, to locate a hidden gem featuring some of the best barbecue food in Atlanta.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels to Oahu, Hawaii, to sample the amazing pizzas of Chinatown, a monstrously big sandwich, and a classic Hawaiian dish so secretive it was once deemed illegal.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Celebrity chef Jamie Oliver uses wild mushrooms picked in his local forest to rustle up simple dishes including risotto, bruschetta and a venison and funghi stroganoff. His mentor Gennaro Contaldo explains the dangers of some varieties, before sampling the recipes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver joins a partridge shoot, finding out from a gamekeeper how to get involved with the countryside. He then rustles up dishes using fresh game birds and recipes inspired by Asian, European and traditional British cuisine, designed to get the best flavour possible.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger heads to Northern California for two spectacular wood-fired Mediterranean seafood feasts.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger meets two chefs celebrating South American grilling styles in Northern California, where they cook slow roasted spring lamb on the grill.(n)

programme.title: Ginormous Food
programme.desc: Josh Denny visits Richmond, a city packed with monumental meals, heading to The Halligan Bar and Grill, where a former fireman has mastered smoke and fire to make the Flatliner.(n)

programme.title: Ginormous Food
programme.desc: Josh Denny travels through Nashville, the heart of country music, in search of magnificent meals.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie Degel helps a woman whose first attempt at running a restaurant is proving to be a disaster. But with bad reviews and plummeting profits, he has his work cut out.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Fearing the staff's getting carried away with the digital shorts they produce to promote the restaurant, the owners of Amalfi's in Portland contact Charles Stiles for help. Mystery Diners go undercover to investigate.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Michael, the owner of Rock Island Cafe in Honolulu, is concerned about a drop in his restaurant's memorabilia sales. Charles Stiles sends in Mystery Diners and discovers the staff is using the restaurant for personal business.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin oversees a delivery of manure for Paul, but ends up with it on his own driveway by mistake. Comedy, starring Richard Briers.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: Gordon pledges his support to Carole, Colin has problems with his herbal remedies, and a cow called Buttercup runs amok in the squash courts. Comedy, starring Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lenny turns up in the village once more, followed by his long-suffering assistant Cliff. This time, the show-business hopeful becomes convinced that he can finally make a name for himself by becoming an escapologist. Guest starring Tommy Cannon and Bobby Ball.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Some Adventures of the Inventor of the Mother Stitch.
programme.desc: Barry is shocked to discover his golf captain has moved in next door when Glenda shows a keen interest in her new neighbours. Hobbo tries to help a dejected Morton feel less lonely, while Hobbo's driving skills attract unwanted attention when he takes to the wheel of a truck following a visit to an inn.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Mother of All Mistakes - Or Is It?.
programme.desc: Hobbo discovers the whereabouts of his real mother and decides to pay her a visit, but is unimpressed by the welcome he receives. Marina chains herself to a supermarket trolley in protest against the unreliability of men, while Nelly reveals some information that greatly lifts Hobbo's spirits.(n)

programme.desc: A squeak on Granville's bike interferes with his hopes of romance, and Arkwright worries about a mysterious visitor to a house in Atkinson Terrace. Comedy, with Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Lynda Baron.(n)

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: The Goods begin to reap their just rewards for the hard work they have put into the garden, although Barbara is too tired and bored to appreciate the benefits. Sitcom, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley

programme.title: The Good Life
programme.desc: Tom Good decides he has had enough of commuting - but his alternative method causes embarrassment among the well-to-do neighbours. First episode of the classic comedy, starring Richard Briers, Felicity Kendal, Paul Eddington and Penelope Keith.(n)

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's sense of authority begins to wane when the arrival of new neighbour Paul threatens the equilibrium in his community. The first episode of the sitcom, starring Richard Briers as an obsessive middle-aged man who yearns to be at the centre of his local suburban neighbourhood. With Penelope Wilton and Peter Egan. First broadcast in 1984.(n)

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds begin leading separate lives back in their home towns. In Essex, Smithy makes efforts to remind Gavin of the excitement of his bachelor years with a traditional boys' night out. Meanwhile in Barry, Stacey tries to distract herself with a trip to the bingo.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow
programme.desc: The comedian continues his tour of the UK's most prestigious venues by visiting the Birmingham Hippodrome. Shappi Khorsandi leads the showcase of stand-ups, with support from Tom Stade, Steve Hughes and Paul Tonkinson.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark continues to be tormented by doubts about marrying Sophie, and joins a gym to spend as much time away from her as possible. Meanwhile, Jeremy starts working as a cleaner in a bid to get closer to ex-wife Nancy, hoping for a reconciliation.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Richie prepares for his birthday celebration - but suffers an accident while putting up the decorations and breaks his leg. Only Eddie's mates Spudgun and Dave Hedgehog show up at the party and it dawns on Richie that he has no real friends. Anarchic comedy, starring Rik Mayell and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow
programme.desc: The comedian continues his tour of the UK's most prestigious venues by visiting the Birmingham Hippodrome. Shappi Khorsandi leads the showcase of stand-ups, with support from Tom Stade, Steve Hughes and Paul Tonkinson.(n)

programme.title: Big School
programme.desc: It's talent show time at Greybridge School, with the staff providing the acts while the pupils pull off their best Simon Cowell impressions. Mr Church is reluctant to enter until Miss Postern suggests a duet with her, although artistic differences look set to ruin their chances. PE teacher Mr Gunn seems favourite to win with his Keith Lemon impersonation - before some unexpected late entries throw the competition wide open. Classroom comedy, starring David Walliams, Catherine Tate, Philip Glenister and Frances de la Tour.(n)

programme.title: Bottom

programme.title: The Smell of Reeves and Mortimer
programme.desc: Vic and Bob host another half-hour of the silly, outrageous and downright stupid, with the bald-headed Stott brothers appearing on This Is Your Life, and dodgy councillors Cox and Evans brightening up the seafront at Aldington-on-Sea with celebrity litter bins.(n)

programme.title: Little Britain
programme.desc: Roman's facial gets out of hand when estranged wife Bubbles interferes, and Dudley is shocked by Ting Tong's latest revelations, but cannot resist her tight green outfit. Orville is harassed in a supermarket and Marjorie Dawes gets star-struck when a celebrity addition to Fat Fighters arrives. Featuring guest appearances by Rob Brydon and former EastEnder Derek Martin (Charlie Slater).(n)

programme.desc: While abroad on a business trip, Rex plays a joke on Martin placing him in a compromising position as he awakens and making him fear he has been unfaithful to Anne. Comedy, starring Richard Briers.(n)

programme.title: The Brittas Empire
programme.desc: In the process of standing accused of a series of murders, it seems Gordon has actually foiled an international drugs ring. Comedy, with Chris Barrie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will Howard Cross the Atlantic Single-Handed?.
programme.desc: Hobbo is convinced Nelly is his natural mother and tries to establish where he was born, while Howard vows to row across the Atlantic single-handed in a bid to counter Marina's suggestions that he lacks spontaneity. Barry's clothing problem is solved when he is called to help clear Toby's blocked drain.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Looking Sideways at Nelly?.
programme.desc: Hobbo enlists the help of Aunty Wainwright to become a master of disguise and deceive his secret enemies, and is delighted when Marina is attracted to his new looks - to the great annoyance of Howard. programme.sub-title: Nobody Messes with Tony the Throat.

programme.title: House of Fools
programme.desc: The return of the comedy set in a chaotic household, written by and starring Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer. Bob feels that his 23-year-old son Erik has come of age and decides to arrange a surprise blind date for him at Julie's bistro with a woman Beef found on the internet. However, Erik has problems selecting an appropriate outfit, while Vic and Bob fall out over their band's debut gig, which is also due to take place at the restaurant that night. With Matt Berry, Daniel Simonsen and Ellie White.(n)

programme.desc: Nessa goes into labour a month early in Barry, and the newlyweds must forget their differences to track down Smithy in time for the birth of his child. Meanwhile, Stacey returns to Essex to salvage her marriage.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Dermot's pre-marriage nerves get the better of him and he locks himself away in a cupboard, so it is up to Agnes, Father Quinn and best man Buster to try to calm him down. Meanwhile, Rory's secret is revealed to his mother. Bawdy comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll and Paddy Houlihan.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: River Cottage
programme.desc: Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall celebrates the best food that the UK has to offer. He rustles up an impressive range of dishes, using the finest seasonal produce.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Austens from West Sussex, whose income has reduced by a third since mum Denise recently gave up work. However, the family are guilty of stockpiling food to the point where they cannot open the fridge door without items falling out - and they are utterly devoted to high-end brands, refusing to buy anything other than their favourite labels.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs compete in the second heat, with the skills tests challenging three of them to create an omelette Arnold Bennett, and the other three to produce two types of brandy snaps. All of the chefs then have the chance to impress with their signature dish, aiming to prove to Gregg Wallace, Marcus Wareing and Monica Galetti that they deserve a place in the quarter-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers go in search of mothers who love to cook during lazy weekends, and discover the meals they enjoy preparing, including peach paradise pudding, chicken pie, beef stew and a plava cake. The bikers also rustle up banana pancakes with bacon and spiced teacakes and braised steaks, while historian Gerard Baker challenges five people to a ravioli-making contest.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer shows how the stress can be taken out of everyday suppers, demonstrating recipes that can be easily made by planning ahead, including vegetable-patch stew and even home-made ice-cream. Nigel also visits a couple whose London barge is an oasis of fruit and veg, making a salad from their produce.(n)

programme.title: Luke Nguyen's Street Food Asia
programme.desc: Part two of two. The chef completes his street food journey in Jakarta, where he indulges in an Indonesian dessert and searches for the best nasi goreng.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Korean Food Tour
programme.desc: John heads out on a tour of Majang Meat Market, a BBQ hotspot. After grilling some choice cuts, he reaches for the greens on a trip to a lettuce farm.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg and Chris help Clare and Richard from Hatfield, Hertfordshire, who are so busy with work and looking after two young children they have found themselves stuck in a rather unusual rut - seven years ago they devised a weekly meal plan - Monday is pizza, Wednesday is spaghetti bolognese and so on - and it hasn't changed since. Not only this, but they always buy big brands and premium supermarket ranges, which is an expensive way to shop for what has become a boring way to eat. Gregg and Chris are determined to help them - but breaking the family's habits isn't going to be easy.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Six chefs battle it out in the first quarter-final, in which the judges ask them to make dishes of their own invention from a selection of ingredients including poussin, squid, mango and dark chocolate. After a double elimination, the remaining contestants have to cook two courses for food critics Tracey MacLeod, Jay Rayner and William Sitwell, before finding out who is going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers: Mums Know Best
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers meet three keen cooks from Northern Ireland who take inspiration from international cuisine. The duo sample paella and Catalan tomato bread, a chicken curry with handmade roti bread, and an Argentinean recipe using partridge. The bikers also prepare their version of haddock mornay and Gerard Baker organises another cookery challenge.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Cooking
programme.desc: The food writer provides everyday cooking advice, demonstrating recipes that are uncomplicated and easy to remember. In the first edition, he prepares five sweet and sour dishes, including pork chops with gooseberry and rhubarb with caramel sauce, before meeting two friends who make oriental lemongrass and sea bass parcels served with a pineapple dip.(n)

programme.desc: The chef visits historic Hue, where he prepares the local delicacy lemongrass skewers.(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: A man finds himself getting an unexpected crash course in the psychology of contemporary women in this romantic comedy. Nick Marshall (Mel Gibson) is a successful advertising executive living in Chicago who has long fancied himself a ladies' man, though he has precious little understanding of women beyond figuring out how to seduce them. One day, Nick receives a substantial electric shock in an accident in his bathroom; while he's not seriously injured, when he comes to, he discovers something remarkable has happened -- he can suddenly hear what women are thinking. At first, Nick finds himself learning all sorts of things he didn't want to know, but he also realizes how this can be used to his advantage -- especially after his old boss, Dan Wanamaker (Alan Alda) is replaced by a woman, Darcy Maguire (Helen Hunt). But Nick begins to feel differently about his unusual gift when he discovers Darcy is infatuated with him, and he finds himself falling for her. What Women Want also features Bette Midler as Nick's analyst, Delta Burke and Valerie Perrine as two of his co-workers, and Marisa Tomei as one of Nick's significant others(n)

programme.title: The Happening
programme.desc: Lady in the Water director M. Night Shyamalan puts PG-13 suspense on pause to tell this grim apocalyptic tale about a family fleeing a natural disaster that poses a grave threat to the whole of humanity. Philadelphia high-school science teacher Elliot Moore (Mark Wahlberg) is discussing the disappearance of the bees with his students when the staff is summoned to the theater and briefed about a mysterious event that is currently unfolding in New York City. According to reports, citizens in the vicinity of Central Park have suddenly and inexplicably begun seizing up just before killing themselves by whatever means are at their disposal. As the phenomena begins to spread and talk of terrorism fills the airwaves, Elliot, his wife, Alma (Zooey Deschanel), their friend Julian (John Leguizamo), and his daughter, Jess (Ashlyn Sanchez), board a train bound for the presumed safety of the country. When the train screeches to a halt before arriving at its final destination, however, the frightened passengers are forced to fend for themselves as each consecutive news report paints an increasingly grim picture of the situation in more urbanized areas. Theories abound on what could be causing the unexplainable rash of suicides, but the only thing that everyone seems to agree on is that it's some kind of airborne contagion that is carried in the wind. It would appear that humankind's reign on planet Earth has come to an end, but perhaps if this small band of survivors can find a safe place to lie low until this all blows over, all hope for survival of the species might not be lost just yet(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy named Jake (Asa Butterfield) follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities, and learns he is destined to protect them. Eva Green, Samuel L. Jackson, Kim Dickens, Allison Janney, Judi Dench, Chris O'Dowd, Rupert Everett, and Terence Stamp co-star. Directed by Tim Burton, Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children was adapted from Ransom Riggs' debut novel of the same name(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: A young newlywed couple honeymoon in Europe, where obstacles challenge their ability to sustain the marriage(n)

programme.title: Every Brilliant Thing
programme.desc: Jonny Donahoe performs in a one-person play about a man who came of age with a suicidal mother but, at various stages of his life, set about compiling a long list of reasons to live. Filmed at the Barrow Street Theatre in New York City in 2015(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Traditionally, angels are supposed to have snowy wings, spotless flowing robes and be bathed in heavenly light, but not Michael (John Travolta). With a hairy pot belly, long hair, a cigarette addiction, an insatiable sugar craving and filthy wings, the archangel Michael is anything but angelic looking. His unkempt appearance and the fact that he is found holed up in a ramshackle boarding house in a beat-up Iowa backwater, makes it even harder to believe that he is anything but a bum. Still when the publisher of the National Mirror, the country's top tabloid learns there may be an angel afoot, he sends three reporters out to cover the story. Slightly embittered writer Frank Quinlan (William Hurt) hopes the story will bust him out of his slump. Hapless photographer Huey (Robert Pastorelli) worries that one more botched job will cause publisher Vartan Malt (Bob Hoskins) to take away his one lucrative gig shooting celebrity wonder-dog Sparky. The enigmatic Dorothy (Andie MacDowell) is supposedly an expert on all things angelic. Together the disparate trio travel to Iowa and meet Pansy Millbank (Jean Stapleton) the aged owner of a run-down rooming house who tells them how Michael miraculously saved her from financial ruin. In return, she allows him to stay at her place. Naturally, the reporters want to meet this phenomenon, but they are ill-prepared at what groggily stumps down the stairs to greet them. From the stubble-faced, boxer-short wearing, smouldering mess before them, they learn that all high-ranking angels are allowed 26 Earthly vacations for all eternity. This is Michael's final vacation and he wants to have fun. The reporters only want to get as much publicity as they can from their ethereal visitor and so set off with him to Chicago. Along the way, they have many funny misadventures(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: A very loose remake of the classic multi-star comedy It's a Mad Mad Mad Mad World (1963), this madcap comedy is directed by Jerry Zucker, one third of the Zucker-Abrahams-Zucker comedy team and director of Ghost (1990). John Cleese stars as an eccentric casino owner who devises a contest pitting six teams against each other in a race to claim two million dollars from a locker in New Mexico. The competitors are Owen (Cuba Gooding Jr., who ends up driving a bus full of Lucille Ball imitators, a foreigner (Rowan Atkinson) who hitches a ride in an organ donor vehicle, and a recently reunited mother and daughter (Whoopi Goldberg and Lanei Chapman) who anger a "squirrel lady" (Kathy Bates) -- much to their regret. There are also two con artist brothers (Seth Green and Vince Vieluf), the upright Nick (Breckin Meyer), who gets a lift from cute but psychotic pilot Tracy (Amy Smart), and the eccentric Pear family, headed up by Jon Lovitz. Rat Race also stars Dave Thomas, Kathy Najimy, Wayne Knight, Dean Cain, and Paul Rodriguez(n)

programme.title: HBO First Look: 'War for the Planet of the Apes'

programme.desc: Nearly 20 years after her death, Princess Diana's sons, Prince William and Prince Harry, recall their mother's influence on their lives, her public persona and her humanitarian work as they leaf through a private family album(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
