programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.sub-title: U.S. Withdrawal From the Paris Agreement
programme.desc: U.S. Withdrawal From the Paris Agreement. The 2015 Paris Agreement, the United States' withdrawal and the world's reaction to this decision are discussed(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: After the long-delayed Town and Country, director Peter Chelsom turns in his second 2001 effort with this love-at-first-sight romantic comedy that revolves around fate, destiny, and chance. Jonathan (John Cusack) and Sara (Kate Beckinsale) are two New Yorkers already in relationships when they meet one another, each reaching for the last pair of cashmere gloves at a department store. Over coffee, they strike up an intimate conversation, and Jonathan thinks they should see each other again. Unconvinced, Sara arranges an elaborate series of "fate" games; if they're meant to be together, she reasons, she and Jonathan will receive some sort of sign in the future. Flash forward several years, and the two are at opposite ends of the country -- Jonathan in New York and Sara in San Francisco, both engaged to be married. Still, neither can shake the memory of their chance encounter, and they both enlist their best friends (Molly Shannon and Jeremy Piven) to help them find their true love again. Serendipity had its Gala World Premiere at the 2001 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: An accountant moonlights as a hit man(n)

programme.title: The Defiant Ones
programme.desc: Part 1. Premiere of a four-part documentary series spotlighting the unlikely, but durable partnership between music producer Jimmy Iovine and rapper Dr. Dre. The opener follows Dre's story in Compton, Cal., and his fascination with dance music and Iovine's early days in Brooklyn(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.sub-title: U.S. Withdrawal From the Paris Agreement
programme.desc: U.S. Withdrawal From the Paris Agreement. The 2015 Paris Agreement, the United States' withdrawal and the world's reaction to this decision are discussed(n)

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: In this gothic romance set at the turn of the 20th century, a mysterious stranger named Sir Thomas Sharpe (Tom Hiddleston) woos young author Edith Cushing (Mia Wasikowska) and brings her as his bride to his mansion atop a clay mountain in Cumbria, England. There, Edith meets Sharpe's strange and secretive sister Lucille (Jessica Chastain), and learns that her new home holds many disturbing secrets that will force her to fight for her sanity and her very life. Directed by Guillermo del Toro(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: A look at the dangerous world of camel racing; a report on the debate over Native American mascots; and a study of the injury rate among cheerleaders. Correspondents include Bernard Goldberg and Frank Deford(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Otherworldly villains are on the loose again, and it's up to Earth's interstellar police force to bring them to justice in this sequel to the sci-fi comedy blockbuster Men in Black. Agent Jay (Will Smith) has become a high-ranking member of the Men in Black, the secret government task force designed to deal with unruly visitors from other worlds, while his former cohort, Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones), had his memory wiped clean and now lives a simple but contented life as a mailman. However, an especially nasty alien threat has reared its not-so-ugly head; Serleena (Lara Flynn Boyle) is a shape-shifting Kylothian alien who is in pursuit of another escaped visitor who holds the key to powers that would allow her to destroy the world. Making Serleena all the more dangerous is the fact she's taken on the appearance of a lingerie model, making her irresistible to most men. When the rampaging Serleena takes control of the MIB offices, Jay is forced to turn to the only man who can help him save the world -- the former Agent Kay. After restoring Kay's memory, the two remaining Men in Black set out to conquer Serleena with a motley band of friendly aliens, including a handful of worm creatures and a talking dog named Frank (voice of Tim Blaney). Jay, meanwhile, has his head turned by Laura (Rosario Dawson), an attractive waitress who was an unwitting witness to an alien attack. Men in Black 2 also features Rip Torn, Tony Shalhoub, David Cross, Patrick Warburton, and Johnny Knoxville(n)

programme.title: Mr. Baseball
programme.desc: An ailing baseball player accepts a transfer to Japan and experiences a severe culture shock in this sports comedy. Tom Selleck stars as major league player Jack Elliot, a champ who has seen better days and whose attitude to the game is laid-back, to say the least. When a Japanese team asks him to join them, he's only too happy, thinking that the change of climate and company might just rekindle his success. However, having arrived in the country Jack realizes that baseball isn't played in quite the same way in Japan(n)

programme.title: Krampus
programme.desc: After losing faith in Christmas, a young boy accidentally summons the malevolent holiday demon Krampus and his minions. The fearsome creatures proceed to wreak havoc on him and his dysfunctional family in this yuletide horror comedy based on ancient folklore(n)

In this inspiring biopic, Jackie Robinson breaks Major League Baseball's color barrier when he is signed to the Brooklyn Dodgers by the team's forward-thinking general manager, Branch Rickey. The gifted athlete deals with tremendous pressure and threats from racist fans and players, but perseveres to become a legendary baseball player and a heroic figure in American history(n)

programme.title: The Trans List
programme.desc: Notable transgender individuals, including Caitlyn Jenner, Caroline Cossey, Buck Angel and Laverne Cox, are interviewed. They candidly discuss their experiences and what it means to be transgender in this fascinating documentary(n)

programme.title: Suicide Squad
programme.desc: In this wild and anarchic "super-antihero" film, a team of incarcerated villains, including Deadshot, Harley Quinn, Enchantress, El Diablo and Killer Croc, are recruited by the government for a dangerous mission in exchange for reduced sentences(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: After a freak accident causes all the tapes in a video store to be erased, an employee and his friend decide to make their own no-budget re-creations of various hit movies(n)

programme.title: Last Week Tonight With John Oliver
programme.sub-title: U.S. Withdrawal From the Paris Agreement
programme.desc: U.S. Withdrawal From the Paris Agreement. The 2015 Paris Agreement, the United States' withdrawal and the world's reaction to this decision are discussed(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: En la idílica isla griega de Kalokairi, Donna Sheridan, una madre soltera, se pone muy nerviosa cuando su hija, a punto de casarse, invita a tres de los ex amantes de su madre a la boda con la intención de descubrir la identidad de su padre. Musicalizada(n)

programme.title: Ballers
programme.desc: Seeds of Expansion. Season 3 begins with Spencer looking to score some high-profile clients to pay off his debts, but he hits a roadblock when Mr. Anderson wants to focus on the Las Vegas market by partnering with a casino magnate. Meanwhile, Ricky ponders fatherhood; Vernon and Reggie eye an edgy endorsement; and Larry makes Charles the face of bad news at a team press conference(n)

programme.title: Game of Thrones
programme.desc: Stormborn. Daenerys has a surprise visitor; Jon faces a revolt; Tyrion draws up plans to conquer Westeros(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Joneses
programme.desc: An ordinary suburban couple (Zach Galifianakis and Isla Fisher) discover that their hospitable new neighbors (Jon Hamm and Gal Gadot) are actually government spies. Soon, all four of them are caught up in an international espionage imbroglio. Greg Mottola (Superbad, Adventureland) directed this action comedy(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: The pot-smoking friends are suspected of being terrorists(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Years after the events of The Bourne Ultimatum, former CIA assassin Jason Bourne (Matt Damon) resurfaces just as his former employers are implementing a new program aimed at hunting him down. Now fully recovered from his amnesia, Bourne teams up with Nicky Parsons (Julia Stiles) to uncover the truth behind his father's death, while simultaneously exacting revenge and evading the government forces hot on his trail. Paul Greengrass returns to helm this sequel, which co-stars Tommy Lee Jones, Alicia Vikander, Riz Ahmed, and Vincent Cassel(n)

programme.title: HBO First Look: 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: In this slick comedy, mobster Chili Palmer ditches the movie biz for the music industry when he decides to manage a singer(n)

programme.title: Fracture
programme.desc: Legal thriller about a brilliant engineer trying to get away with murder and the dogged prosecutor on his tail(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: A young newlywed couple honeymoon in Europe, where obstacles challenge their ability to sustain the marriage(n)

programme.title: Every Brilliant Thing
programme.desc: Jonny Donahoe performs in a one-person play about a man who came of age with a suicidal mother but, at various stages of his life, set about compiling a long list of reasons to live. Filmed at the Barrow Street Theatre in New York City in 2015(n)

programme.title: Michael
programme.desc: Traditionally, angels are supposed to have snowy wings, spotless flowing robes and be bathed in heavenly light, but not Michael (John Travolta). With a hairy pot belly, long hair, a cigarette addiction, an insatiable sugar craving and filthy wings, the archangel Michael is anything but angelic looking. His unkempt appearance and the fact that he is found holed up in a ramshackle boarding house in a beat-up Iowa backwater, makes it even harder to believe that he is anything but a bum. Still when the publisher of the National Mirror, the country's top tabloid learns there may be an angel afoot, he sends three reporters out to cover the story. Slightly embittered writer Frank Quinlan (William Hurt) hopes the story will bust him out of his slump. Hapless photographer Huey (Robert Pastorelli) worries that one more botched job will cause publisher Vartan Malt (Bob Hoskins) to take away his one lucrative gig shooting celebrity wonder-dog Sparky. The enigmatic Dorothy (Andie MacDowell) is supposedly an expert on all things angelic. Together the disparate trio travel to Iowa and meet Pansy Millbank (Jean Stapleton) the aged owner of a run-down rooming house who tells them how Michael miraculously saved her from financial ruin. In return, she allows him to stay at her place. Naturally, the reporters want to meet this phenomenon, but they are ill-prepared at what groggily stumps down the stairs to greet them. From the stubble-faced, boxer-short wearing, smouldering mess before them, they learn that all high-ranking angels are allowed 26 Earthly vacations for all eternity. This is Michael's final vacation and he wants to have fun. The reporters only want to get as much publicity as they can from their ethereal visitor and so set off with him to Chicago. Along the way, they have many funny misadventures(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: A very loose remake of the classic multi-star comedy It's a Mad Mad Mad Mad World (1963), this madcap comedy is directed by Jerry Zucker, one third of the Zucker-Abrahams-Zucker comedy team and director of Ghost (1990). John Cleese stars as an eccentric casino owner who devises a contest pitting six teams against each other in a race to claim two million dollars from a locker in New Mexico. The competitors are Owen (Cuba Gooding Jr., who ends up driving a bus full of Lucille Ball imitators, a foreigner (Rowan Atkinson) who hitches a ride in an organ donor vehicle, and a recently reunited mother and daughter (Whoopi Goldberg and Lanei Chapman) who anger a "squirrel lady" (Kathy Bates) -- much to their regret. There are also two con artist brothers (Seth Green and Vince Vieluf), the upright Nick (Breckin Meyer), who gets a lift from cute but psychotic pilot Tracy (Amy Smart), and the eccentric Pear family, headed up by Jon Lovitz. Rat Race also stars Dave Thomas, Kathy Najimy, Wayne Knight, Dean Cain, and Paul Rodriguez(n)

programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: Satan's hopeless son is banished to earth when he disappoints his father one time too many, but finds New York City just as confusing as hell(n)

programme.title: The World According to Garp
programme.desc: A writer deals with an overbearing mother, a nurse who turns into a controversial and famous feminist figure after publishing a memoir that becomes more successful than any of her son's books. She takes in a series of lost souls, many of whom affect Garp's life and family(n)

programme.title: Making of 'My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2'
programme.desc: A look at "My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2," a 2016 sequel to the 2002 hit that follows the Portokalos clan as they celebrate another momentous walk down the aisle. The film stars Nia Vardalos, John Corbett, Lainie Kazan and Michael Constantine, and is directed by Kirk Jones(n)

programme.title: Get Smart
programme.desc: Bumbling agent Maxwell Smart (Steve Carell), of the top-secret agency CONTROL, teams up with Agent 99 (Anne Hathaway), a lethal beauty, to protect the world from the forces of KAOS. But can the world survive the chaos Max inadvertently creates? Alan Arkin, Dwayne Johnson, Terence Stamp(n)

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Comedy about a cabaret singer who witnesses a murder and goes undercover as a nun. In the convent, she is put in charge of coaching the choir, which she transforms into a toe-tapping rhythm group. As a result, the church's congregation swells until even the Pope comes to witness pop classics such as 'My Guy' performed to glorify the Lord. But, of course, her fame gives away her hiding place to the killer(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: Playwright William Shakespeare has hit a dry patch, until the beautiful Viola de Lesseps enters his life and sets his creative juices flowing(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: Toula and Ian are parents to a teenage daughter in this sequel that brings the entire Portokalos family together for another huge wedding(n)

programme.title: Ernest Scared Stupid
programme.desc: The troll who menaced a community returns generations later to harrass the last surviving descendant, village idiot Ernest P Worrell. Comedy for the kids(n)

programme.title: The Man with Two Brains
programme.desc: One year after the film noir spoof Dead Men Don't Wear Plaid, Carl Reiner and Steve Martin set their sights on science fiction in The Man with Two Brains. In the film, a surgeon (Martin) falls in love with the disembodied brain of a patient (voice by Sissy Spacek) and learns that a scientist he knows has perfected the process of brain transfer. The doctor, trying to realizing his dreams, attempts to transfer the brain into his unloved wife's body (Kathleen Turner)(n)

But, of course, her fame gives away her hiding place to the killer(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: Toula and Ian are parents to a teenage daughter in this sequel that brings the entire Portokalos family together for another huge wedding(n)

programme.title: Search Party
programme.desc: Distraught over the realization that they scared away a friend's fiancée, two hard-partying pals set out on a wild journey to Mexico to reunite the estranged couple by any means necessary(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Packed to the gills with references to mob movies from The Godfather to Casino, the story of an Italian boy who comes to America and becomes entangled with the all-powerful Mafia provides on opportunity for director Jim Abrahams to poke fun at the genre in his distinctive gag-a-minute style using everything from visual puns to verbal acrobatics in his quest to raise a laugh. The gags come thick and fast in this Mafia spoof from the makers of Airplane! and The Naked Gun(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two unruly brothers (Zac Efron and Adam DeVine) are forced to find dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii by their parents, who hope that a couple of nice gals will keep their wild behavior under control. However, a pair of hard-partying ladies (Anna Kendrick and Aubrey Plaza) see a viral video in which they plead for dates, and decide to pretend to be the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip. Directed by Jake Szymanski(n)

programme.title: The Good Guy
programme.desc: After executive producing the acclaimed documentary Manda Bala and the J.M. Coetzee adaptation Disgrace, Julio DePietro makes his feature debut as a writer-director with The Good Guy, a drama about ambitious young Wall Streeters fighting each other -- and sometimes their own decent nature -- to get ahead in the world. Our narrator, Tommy (Scott Porter of TV's Friday Night Lights), is young, clever, charming, and attractive. He's got a smart, pretty girlfriend, Beth (Alexis Bledel of Gilmore Girls), an urban conservationist. He's also very good at his investment broker job, impressing his ruthless, cynical boss, Cash (erstwhile "Brat Pack" member Andrew McCarthy). When a key member of Tommy's sales team suddenly leaves for a competitor, Tommy needs to fill his spot quickly, and takes a chance on the bumbling Daniel (Bryan Greenberg, Bride Wars), a former Marine and computer geek who seems a bit naïve about high finance and a bit nervous around women. Tommy takes Daniel under his wing, showing him how to dress, where to socialize, and how to charm attractive women. Their relationship is threatened when Daniel begins spending more time with Beth, joining her book club, and becoming her confidant. Tommy begins to question his decision to share his wisdom with Daniel, while Daniel is forced to decide what success really means to him, and where his loyalties lie. The Good Guy also stars Anna Chlumsky (In the Loop) and Aaron Yoo (Disturbia). The film had its world premiere at the 2009 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Bushwhacked
programme.desc: Luckless Max Grabelski is set up for a murder he did not commit. On the run, he camps out in the same forest as a scout group. Will the ankle-biters rumble the towny in his leather jacket and loafers, or will Max tame the wilds? Slapstick(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: Sick of being bullied by her overpowering Greek family, dowdy Toula signs up for college. Despite every warning, Toula falls for a non-Greek guy, but it's not easy getting her clan to accept him(n)

programme.title: Earth Girls Are Easy
programme.desc: Extraterrestrials crash land in a Valley Girl's swimming pool, and integrate themselves in American culture while fixing their space ship(n)

programme.title: Sixteen Candles
programme.desc: A girl's sixteenth birthday is forgotten by her family who are distracted by the upcoming wedding of her older sister, and to compound things, she has a crush on a popular older classmate and is suffering the unwanted attentions of a sophomoric geek(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Docudrama about two young arms dealers who win a $300 million contract to supply weaponry to US forces in Afghanistan(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Otherworldly villains are on the loose again, and it's up to Earth's interstellar police force to bring them to justice in this sequel to the sci-fi comedy blockbuster Men in Black. Agent Jay (Will Smith) has become a high-ranking member of the Men in Black, the secret government task force designed to deal with unruly visitors from other worlds, while his former cohort, Agent Kay (Tommy Lee Jones), had his memory wiped clean and now lives a simple but contented life as a mailman. However, an especially nasty alien threat has reared its not-so-ugly head; Serleena (Lara Flynn Boyle) is a shape-shifting Kylothian alien who is in pursuit of another escaped visitor who holds the key to powers that would allow her to destroy the world. Making Serleena all the more dangerous is the fact she's taken on the appearance of a lingerie model, making her irresistible to most men. When the rampaging Serleena takes control of the MIB offices, Jay is forced to turn to the only man who can help him save the world -- the former Agent Kay. After restoring Kay's memory, the two remaining Men in Black set out to conquer Serleena with a motley band of friendly aliens, including a handful of worm creatures and a talking dog named Frank (voice of Tim Blaney). Jay, meanwhile, has his head turned by Laura (Rosario Dawson), an attractive waitress who was an unwitting witness to an alien attack. Men in Black 2 also features Rip Torn, Tony Shalhoub, David Cross, Patrick Warburton, and Johnny Knoxville(n)

programme.title: Airheads
programme.desc: Comedy about a struggling Los Angeles rock band who are so desperate to get their record played on air that they hijack a radio station. The Lone Rangers have had little luck in attracting interest from a record company, so they take their demo tape to Radio KPPX and, armed with water pistols, burst into the studio of the star DJ. But the hold-up goes wrong when their tape is accidentally destroyed(n)

programme.title: I-Spy
programme.desc: Espionage comedy starring Eddie Murphy and Owen Wilson. An inexperienced CIA agent (Wilson) is assigned to track down the arms dealers who stole a high-tech US fighter plane that has the technology to become invisible. The only problem is he has to team up with a cocky, and often idiotic, professional boxer, of whom the arms dealers are known to be fans. Also stars Famke Janssen and Malcolm McDowell(n)

programme.title: Protocol
programme.desc: A cocktail waitress accidentally saves the life of an important visiting Arab diplomat when she takes a bullet in her behind. Thrown into the media spotlight, she is then recruited by the US Department of Protocol but soon finds that the world of political chicanery is not best suited to her particular talents(n)

programme.title: Camp Nowhere
programme.desc: This light-hearted comedy depicts a typical summer camp, but with a special twist: this camp was designed by the campers themselves! "Mud" Himmel is a nerd. Once again he is faced with attending computer camp. His buddy Zack will be marching into go to military camp while Trish is acting happy about theater camp. That Gaby is going again to fat camp weighs heavily upon her mind. None of them are thrilled with their camp prospects and it is rebellious Mud who suggest that they create their own, secret camp. Enter Dennis Van Welker, their crazy high school drama instructor. He offers to join the conspiracy and act as their camp counselor. Just as it looks as if the four misfits are going to have a really great summer together, two dozen of their peers find out about the camp and decide to come along. For a time it's one big chaotic party. But as the kids act out their camp fantasies, they are gaining valuable insight into their lives(n)

programme.title: August Rush
programme.desc: Kirsten Sheridan's family drama stars Freddie Highmore (Charlie from Tim Burton's Charlie and the Chocolate Factory) as Evan Taylor, a musical prodigy searching for his parents. When pregnant cellist Lyla Novacek was hit by a car, her controlling father and manager told her she'd lost the baby; in reality she gave birth prematurely and her father sent the infant to an orphanage. Eleven years later, when Evan finds out that his parents are alive, he sets out to find them, taking inspiration from the music around him. The heart of the film is Evan's almost mystical ability to 'feel' music, a challenging concept that works, thanks to inventive work by main score composer Mark Mancina. August Rush also stars Jonathan Rhys Meyers as Evan's rock singer father, and Robin Williams as a modern day Fagin who Evan meets during his search for his family(n)

programme.title: Hotel for Dogs
programme.desc: Good-natured family film about brother and sister Andi and Bruce's secret enterprise - turning a derelict hotel into a paradise for stray dogs. programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: After the long-delayed Town and Country, director Peter Chelsom turns in his second 2001 effort with this love-at-first-sight romantic comedy that revolves around fate, destiny, and chance. Jonathan (John Cusack) and Sara (Kate Beckinsale) are two New Yorkers already in relationships when they meet one another, each reaching for the last pair of cashmere gloves at a department store. Over coffee, they strike up an intimate conversation, and Jonathan thinks they should see each other again. Unconvinced, Sara arranges an elaborate series of "fate" games; if they're meant to be together, she reasons, she and Jonathan will receive some sort of sign in the future. Flash forward several years, and the two are at opposite ends of the country -- Jonathan in New York and Sara in San Francisco, both engaged to be married. Still, neither can shake the memory of their chance encounter, and they both enlist their best friends (Molly Shannon and Jeremy Piven) to help them find their true love again. Serendipity had its Gala World Premiere at the 2001 Toronto Film Festival(n)

programme.title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
programme.desc: Mulder and Scully have left the FBI and gone their separate ways. Mulder is living in seclusion, while Scully has returned to her medical career. But when an FBI agent goes missing, they're called back to duty. The only person who may be able to track her down is Father Joseph Crissman, a convicted paedophile who professes to be psychic and claims to have already found part of the missing agent's body. But is he telling the truth? Mulder and Scully must overcome their revulsion for his crimes as more agents go missing and saving them becomes a race against time(n)

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: 1992 blockbuster starring Whitney Houston and Kevin Costner - as a singer superstar and her bodyguard who fall in love. Houston hires Costner when she starts receiving death threats from a stalker. The ex-presidential bodyguard has a past, however. He is wracked by guilt over his inability to protect Reagan from John Hinckley's assassination attempt. He's certainly not going to let a bullet slip past himagain and the draconian security measures he sets up are a shock to Houston. But Costner proves his worth when, in the face of death threats, the singer gives the performance of her life at the Oscar ceremony. Houston brings the house down with her performance of the Dolly Parton song 'I Will Always Love You'(n)

There, the friends are changed by brutal beatings and humiliating abuse from the very guards sworn to protect them. Years later, when two of the youths are charged with the murder of one of their old tormentors, the horrible events of their past are revived. But, with one of the four friends serving as prosecutor on the case, the real villains may finally be brought to justice(n)

programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: An overnight shipment of drugs winds up being sent to the wrong recipient, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before the contents are discovered in this fast-paced crime comedy starring Donald Faison, Mos Def, and Mike Epps. When Brody (Epps) and Guch (Wood Harris) received package containing 10 kilos of grade-A cocaine, they assumed their financial woes were a thing of the past. The package was intended for their Brody and Guch's next-door neighbors, but the whacked-out courier (Donald Faison) delivered it to the wrong address. Recognizing the possibility for profit, the scheming duo plans to sell the cocaine to Brody's drug-dealing cousin (Omari Hardwick). Meanwhile Jesus (Cisco Reyes) and his girlfriend Chita (Yasmin Deliz), the intended recipients of the cocaine, set out to procure the package before notorious drug lord Bodego Diablo (Emilio Rivera) realizes it's gone missing. But Bodega is no slouch; he already knows the shipment was botched, and he's determined to get his drugs back no matter what the cost. Later, as Brody and Guch prepare to seal the deal that will set them up for life, the guns are drawn and the chaos begins(n)

programme.title: The Conjuring
programme.desc: A demonic entity lays claim to family living in a secluded farmhouse, prompting them to seek the aid of two renowned paranormal researchers in this tale of possession inspired by actual events. The story gets underway as paranormal researchers Ed (Patrick Wilson) and Lorraine Warren (Vera Farmiga) evaluate a mysterious doll discovered by a trio of young roommates in 1968. Believing their house to be haunted by the wayward spirit of a deceased young girl, they give the girl permission to inhabit the doll, and soon their lives become a waking nightmare. Informed by Ed and Lorraine that they have fallen victim to an inhuman spirit (aka a demon) seeking a human host, the roommates entrust the doll to the Warrens, who place it in their personal museum for safekeeping. Flash forward three years to Harrisville, RI, where the Perron family have just moved into their country dream home -- an 18th century farmhouse that offers plenty of space for parents Carolyn (Lili Taylor) and Roger (Ron Livingston), as well as their five daughters Andrea (Shanley Caswell), Nancy (Hayley McFarland), Christine (Joey King), Cindy (Mackenzie Foy), and April (Kyla Deaver). It seems like the ideal place to raise a family until a series of unsettling events leave the Perron family convinced they are not alone. Terrified, Carolyn reaches out to the Warrens for help, and learns that a demonic entity has attached itself to her family, and has no intentions of letting them go. Meanwhile, the deeper the Warrens delve into the farmhouse's history, the clearer it becomes that this spirit has a murderous agenda, and that no one will be safe until it is driven back into darkness(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: A dystopian fantasy adventure based on an unusually faithful adaptation of the highly regarded graphic novel by Alan Moore, directed by Zach Snyder. It is 1985 and Richard Nixon continues his tenure in the White House, massively popular with the electorate following his crushing defeat of the Viet Cong. However, it seems that the American public have fallen out of love with their superheroes, one of whom, Dr Manhattan, was largely responsible for the winning the Vietnam War. Now, he and his fellow crime-fighters are regarded as reprehensible vigilantes and have been banned by law. But, when one of their number - the vile, ironically named Comedian - is murdered, the former heroes begin to re-emerge from the shadows to investigate. They discover that a terrifying plan is afoot... Also starring Matthew Goode, Malin Akerman, Patrick Wilson and Jackie Earle Haley(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Entrenched in the racial tumult of Los Angeles in the mid-1980's, a group of aspiring rappers banded together to revolutionize the global consumption of hip-hop and popular culture. NWA was born out of racial frustration and the disadvantaged economics of their South Central neighborhood. F. Gary Gray directs this biopic about the rise to stardom for the act that earned the moniker of "The World's Most Dangerous Group", featuring Ice Cube's son O'Shea Jackson Jr. playing the role of his father, Corey Hawkins as Dr. Dre, and Jason Mitchell as the late Eazy-E(n)

Along with a state trooper (Joel Edgerton), the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security. Kirsten Dunst, Adam Driver, and Sam Shepard co-star(n)

N'Bushe Wright, Monica Calhoun, Clifton Powell, Lark Voohies(n)

programme.desc: Clint Eastwood made his directorial bow portraying a nighttime disc jockey who becomes the target of an obsessed fan (Jessica Walter)(n)

programme.title: What Women Want
programme.desc: A man finds himself getting an unexpected crash course in the psychology of contemporary women in this romantic comedy. Nick Marshall (Mel Gibson) is a successful advertising executive living in Chicago who has long fancied himself a ladies' man, though he has precious little understanding of women beyond figuring out how to seduce them. One day, Nick receives a substantial electric shock in an accident in his bathroom; while he's not seriously injured, when he comes to, he discovers something remarkable has happened -- he can suddenly hear what women are thinking. At first, Nick finds himself learning all sorts of things he didn't want to know, but he also realizes how this can be used to his advantage -- especially after his old boss, Dan Wanamaker (Alan Alda) is replaced by a woman, Darcy Maguire (Helen Hunt). But Nick begins to feel differently about his unusual gift when he discovers Darcy is infatuated with him, and he finds himself falling for her. What Women Want also features Bette Midler as Nick's analyst, Delta Burke and Valerie Perrine as two of his co-workers, and Marisa Tomei as one of Nick's significant others(n)

programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: Julia Roberts won the Academy Award® for Best Actress, among five nominations for this stirring, funny and unconventional drama based on real events. Erin Brockovich is in a tight spot following a car accident, though not her fault, her attorney, Ed Masry, fails to land her a settlement. With no money, no job and no prospects, Erin pleads with Ed to hire her at his law firm. There she discovers a cover-up involving contaminated water that's causing devastating illnesses in a local community. By dogged determination and the ability to speak their language, Erin ultimately earns the trust of the locals and signs up more than 600 plaintiffs. Erin and Ed go on to win the largest settlement ever paid in a direct-action lawsuit in U.S. history(n)

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Mr. Monk and the Leper. Reported killed in an hot air balloon accident, reclusive millionaire Derek Bronson (Stephen Bogardus) seemingly returns from the dead to hire Monk (Tony Shalhoub) for a special assignment. The fact that Bronson is suffering from leprosy would normally be enough to send Monk scurrying in the opposite direction, but he is shamed into taking the job by his more tolerant caregiver Natalie (Taylor Howard). Here's the deal: Bronson had initially been willing to remain "dead", but now he wants Monk to deliver proof that he's still alive so that Mrs. Bronson (Sarah Brown) will not be cheated out of her husband's estate by some scheming relatives. Well, it's a good story, but it's not quite true--and without revealing any more of the plot, it can be noted that a pivotal scene articulates the old vaudeville catchphrase "Don't shoot--I'm only the piano player."(n)

programme.title: Escape From the Planet of the Apes
programme.desc: Escape From the Planet of the Apes is the third in the series of films based upon the Planet of the Apes characters created by novelist Pierre Boulle. At the end of the second film, the centuries-in-the-future world colonized by simians was destroyed, but apes Cornelius (Roddy McDowall) and Zira (Kim Hunter) were able to escape in the space vessel left behind by 20th century astronaut George Taylor (Charlton Heston). Cornelius and Zira pass through another time warp, finding themselves in the Earth of the 1970s. When they reveal their ability to speak, the apes are first treated as curiosities, then as threats when the government, believing the story that the Earth will eventually be inherited by monkeys, tries to prevent the birth of Zira's baby. They are ultimately given shelter by sympathetic circus owner Armando (Ricardo Montalban). This film was followed by the fourth "Apes" entry, 1972's Conquest of the Planet of the Apes(n)

programme.desc: The veteran broadcaster presents the second of two programmes lifting the lid on the riches, the pain and the sense of betrayal that life with a mobster can bring - and this time his journey brings him to a series of secret locations meeting mob wives who are all hiding from the Mafia with their partners. They include Donna Mangiavillano, her daughters Stefanie and Victoria and husband Salvatore, who once masterminded bank heists for the mob - only to betray his bosses to the FBI. Now the family live in fear that one day the Mafia will exact its revenge.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Chris is bowled over by new nurse Beth and wastes little time trying to woo her, while Anna is annoyed that the whole village appears to know about her pregnancy, except the one person who really matters. Henry nurses a broken heart and confronts his love rival after one too many in the pub, and David's taxi-driving job takes its toll - resulting in a horrific accident. Drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: The family fears that Du Plessis is having a nervous breakdown when he starts to believe he is being haunted by the ghost of Peeters - and the visions drive him to make a confession to Caroline. Danny and Ed come to a rash decision during an animal rescue, endangering everything they have been working toward. African-set wildlife drama, starring Deon Stewardson, Hayley Mills, Stephen Tompkinson and Robert Bathurst.(n)

programme.title: Judge Judy

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A climber plunges to his death from a cliff face and a police informant claims it was no accident. A re-enactment of the incident adds fuel to the fire, and Wycliffe braces himself to interview the dead man's best friend. Drama, starring Jack Shepherd, Helen Masters, Lynn Farleigh, Christian Solimeno and Paul Venables.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The residents of Aidensfield are terrorised by a blackmailer and Sergeant Merton is less than impressed by the investigative methods of the handsome newcomer PC Rob Walker. Meanwhile, Vernon embarks on a venture in the prestigious world of publishing, with the help of David and Bernie. Jonathan Kerrigan stars.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Goodwin returns from Africa with Biafran orphan Nkeshi, and shocks his colleagues when they realise he has smuggled the child into the country illegally. Medical drama, starring Paul Fox.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: Danny is in prison, accused of murdering Peeters, but Du Plessis sets out to prove his friend's innocence - whatever the cost. Meanwhile, Ed's increasingly suspicious behaviour makes Du Plessis think he is harbouring a dark secret. With nobody around to help her, Rosie goes on a lone search for a wild cheetah, leading her into a dangerous situation.(n)

programme.title: Man About the House
programme.desc: Robin could be about to lose a girlfriend and gain a sister-in-law. Last-ever episode of the comedy, starring Richard O'Sullivan. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan begins courting Blakey's demure, well-to-do niece, who tries to smarten him up - but it only takes one meeting with his family to make her realise he is a hopeless case. Reg Varney and Stephen Lewis star.(n)

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Stan and Jack persuade Inspector Blake to buy Arthur's old motorbike - but he runs into trouble on the test drive. Comedy, starring Reg Varney and Bob Grant.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The residents of Aidensfield are terrorised by a blackmailer and Sergeant Merton is less than impressed by the investigative methods of the handsome newcomer PC Rob Walker. programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica is called to testify in a court case concerning a crooked investment firm, but the key witness dies shortly afterwards. Angela Lansbury stars as the sleuth, with Lisa Eichhorn and Larry Linville.(n)

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The detective is approached by a former mentor from his college days, who asks Morse to ensure the safety of his wife. However, the assignment leaves him contemplating his future with the police force. Meanwhile, a murder in the world of fashion stirs up old gangland conflicts in the city. Detective drama series, starring Shaun Evans as the young Inspector Morse.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin are called to investigate when a man is attacked and his kidney is surgically removed. The focus quickly turns to finding the intended recipient of the organ, and the team is horrified to discover that it has been trafficked into the NHS and given to wealthy patient Joanna Woodleigh. When the case is handed over to the CPS, a conflict of interests becomes apparent as Steel and Phillips go up against George Castle in court. Denis Lawson guest stars, with Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Freema Agyeman.(n)

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Part one of two. Tony meets an old friend at a psychology convention and, after an evening's drinking to celebrate his success as a speaker, is forced to resist her advances. The next morning she is found murdered in her hotel room, and suspicion falls on Tony as he was the last person to see her alive. Back in Bradfield, Alex hunts a serial killer targeting prostitutes, and another experimental psychologist is killed close to home. Psychological thriller based on the novels by Val McDermid, starring Robson Green and Simone Lahbib.(n)

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.(n)

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A sheriff's retirement party in a Texas border town goes awry when Mark witnesses his friend's assassination by five desperadoes. Western drama, starring James Arness.(n)

programme.title: Ironside
programme.desc: A pool hustler is forced to make a shady deal with a crooked promoter in a bid to pay off his brother's gambling debts. Police drama with Raymond Burr.(n)

programme.title: Quincy ME
programme.desc: Twelve patients in a small town come down with a mystery illness, leaving Quincy and Sam racing to identify the disease before any more people are infected. Crime drama, starring Jack Klugman and Robert Ito.(n)

programme.desc: An allegedly accidental drowning at a health spa brings Quincy into conflict with a slick attorney hired to prevent adverse publicity affecting profits. Jack Klugman and Garry Walberg star.(n)

programme.desc: Arthur makes a hasty agreement to stage a burglary after his tailor's staff go on strike demanding more pay. programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: A captured British spy is released when his Russian counterpart falls into British hands. C15 is tasked with ensuring his safety as well as establishing whether his information is genuine. However, such intentions fail miserably when he is poisoned. Bodie and Doyle set out to determine what part his daughter, a concert pianist, played in his death - assuming she really is his daughter.(n)

programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba compete against Victor to buy a luxury household locker in an auction at Mineral Wells.(n)

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The team visits an auction in Irving, where Victor buys a secret agent's locker and Bubba tries to sell some explicit art.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawn shop owners value items including a chair from the Senate floor, a photograph of NASA's Gemini launch, and professional racing driver Ryan Newman's driving suit.(n)

programme.title: Live UEFA Europa League Football
programme.sub-title: Europa League Qualifying Live: Everton v MFK Ruzomberok.
programme.desc: Everton v MFK Ruzomberok (Kick-off 8.05pm). Coverage of the first leg of the third-round qualifier, held at Goodison Park. The Toffees qualified for this competition by finishing seventh in the Premier League last season, and will expect nothing less than a victory this evening against the Slovakian outfit.(n)

programme.title: Goldfinger
programme.desc: James Bond is assigned to investigate a notorious German gold smuggler and discovers his quarry has ambitions much greater than first suspected. Pursuing the criminal mastermind around the world, Bond uncovers the villain's audacious scheme to destroy the global economy with a daring attack on Fort Knox. Spy adventure, starring Sean Connery, Gert Frobe and Honor Blackman.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.desc: Part one of two. When a funeral brings about the reconciliation of two estranged sisters, one of them is consumed with jealousy over the other's lavish lifestyle - bringing fatal consequences. Drama, starring Phoebe Nicholls, Christine Kavanagh, Julian Wadham and Sally Sanders.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.desc: Part two of two. May begins to take over her sister's identity, but only Margery sees a sinister depth to her behaviour, and even she is unable to prevent the tragedy that is about to befall them. Drama, starring Phoebe Nicholls, Christine Kavanagh, Julian Wadham and Sally Sanders. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Rose falls for an Australian, whose talk of the classless society Down Under makes her contemplate emigration. She hands in her notice and sets off to catch the boat - but begins to have second thoughts. Period drama, starring Jean Marsh.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Christine doesn't do herself any favours in the popularity stakes, telling Louise she might not have a job to come back to once she has had the baby, and accusing Robert of taking Jack's side in a problematic case. Meanwhile, Kate gets a final warning after leaving a patient choking, and David makes plans for a party in celebration of his move into surgery. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick finds himself drawn into a family feud after three children claim to have witnessed a supposed witch vandalising a funeral urn.(n)

programme.title: Lillie
programme.desc: Edward dies from alcohol poisoning and Lillie escapes with Jeanne Marie and her mother.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Secret House of Death - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. A secret liaison comes to a tragic end with the deaths of both parties, and the neighbour who discovered them has no reason to doubt the inquest's verdict.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Secret House of Death - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. The true extent of Bob's affair with Magdelene is gradually revealed as Susan's suspicions begin to grow.(n)

programme.title: Outside Edge
programme.desc: As Brent Park Cricket Club prepare for the opening ceremony of their new pitch and pavilion, Mim arranges a big surprise for Rog - but disaster is waiting in the wings. Comedy drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, Robert Daws, Timothy Spall and Josie Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Outside Edge
programme.desc: Roger gets a frosty response when he introduces new team member Clive to the others, while Kev and Mag present Mim with a motorised lawn-mower. Cricketing comedy drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, Robert Daws, Timothy Spall and Josie Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A new family cause panic in Aidensfield when their rabid dog goes missing, and Nick suspects Greengrass of poaching.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Hazel suffers a miscarriage and slips into despondency, though James seems unconcerned by the tragedy, and not only accompanies Georgina Worsley to a ball, but admits to finding her attractive.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: New clinical director Jack tries to curry favour with Christine by criticising Robert's management skills, while David's first day in surgery doesn't go as well as he'd hoped. Mike returns from London wanting his old job back, but walks straight into a fiery situation with Cathy, who's none too pleased to see him. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and David Harewood.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth is summoned when Colin Race is distracted from an investigation into a spy ring by the discovery of a murder victim surrounded by stopped clocks. The body was found at the home of blind former teacher Millicent Pebmarsh, but when a second death is reported, Poirot realises the man was killed elsewhere and brought to the scene, though the neighbours prove unhelpful eyewitnesses. Mystery, starring David Suchet, Anna Massey, Jaime Winstone, Lesley Sharp, Phil Daniels, Geoffrey Palmer and Tessa Peake-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Ellie and Hardy bring a new suspect in for questioning and in a search of this suspect's premises, Ellie finds devastating new evidence linking him to the crime. Back at the station, he gives them his detailed version of events, but when they dig deeper they begin to doubt his story, while DC Katie Harford confronts Ellie and Hardy with an uncomfortable truth about her role in the investigation. The fact that Ian has taken a personal item of Trish's without her knowledge comes to light.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: When dock worker Owen Thorne plunges from the roof of a multi-storey car park while picking up his daughter from her school prom, Vera immediately detects foul play. The team soon discovers a work dispute over the death of a young man, with everyone believing Owen was to blame, and the victim's father admits he wanted revenge - but his alibi holds. The mystery then continues when Vera spots an inconsistency in the statement Owen's wife gave to the police, suggesting she's not certain of her husband's fidelity.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: King Leopold suggests to Victoria that she consider Prince Albert as a possible consort, a development that results in the young queen being surrounded by suitors seeking her hand in marriage, The young queen remains determined to rule alone, a declaration that leaves her uncle suspicious about her relationship with Melbourne.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A cleaner is found dead in her home and suspicion immediately falls upon her lodger, who is arrested and convicted of her murder. It appears to be an open-and-shut case, but Superintendent Spence begins to question the man's guilt and invites Poirot to help uncover the identity of the real killer. The Belgian sleuth teams up with crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Family's Zoe Wanamaker) as he tries to crack the case. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Richard Hope, Joe Absolom, Amanda Root, Sian Phillips and Raquel Cassidy.(n)

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: DI Jane Preston and DS Ben Shaw are called to investigate when a wheel clamper is nearly run down by an irate driver. At first the case seems cut and dried, because the victim has taken down the vehicle registration and identified the occupants as a couple he has clashed with in the past. However, the case takes a twist when the officers' enquiries lead them to another potential suspect with a history of bad driving. Guest starring Bobby Davro and Dean Gaffney.(n)

programme.desc: The actress is left distraught over Edward VII's death and dies alone soon afterwards. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Dandelion Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. Drama set in the 1920s, starring Michael Kitchen as a downtrodden, henpecked solicitor who buys a quantity of arsenic to kill the dandelions on his lawn, and suddenly realises it could be used to solve the problem of his wife as well. With Sarah Miles and David Thewlis.(n)

programme.title: Outside Edge
programme.desc: Rog gets busy organising the team's first match, while Mim tries to cheer up Bob after Ginnie gives him his marching orders. Maggie's sister inadvertently lets slip a secret - with devastating consequences. Cricketing comedy drama, starring Brenda Blethyn.(n)

programme.title: Outside Edge
programme.desc: Kevin and Maggie have an awkward conversation about their fertility problems, while Rog and Mim arrive to discuss the forthcoming marriage blessing. Cricketing comedy drama, starring Josie Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick goes undercover to investigate smuggling in Whitby, while Kate is the bearer of bad news for a girl seeking advice about abortions.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: James is offered a new position in India, but Hazel refuses to accompany him. Meanwhile, talk of war shatters the peace of the Bellamy household, and forbidden passions flare between Daisy and Edward.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Christine grows closer to Jack as her professional relationship with Robert continues to deteriorate, but is under no illusions about what her boss wants from her. Mike realises there are plenty more fish in the sea and vows to have a good time playing the field, and Kate's moonlighting gets her into trouble. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective's friend Sir Charles Cartwright (guest star Martin Shaw) hosts a cocktail party at his home in Cornwall, where an amiable local priest chokes to death on his drink. There seems to be no motive for murder, and no trace of poison found in the victim's glass, but weeks later, when Sir Charles's doctor friend Sir Bartholomew Strange dies in similar circumstances, he and Poirot team up to investigate. Drama, with Art Malik, Jane Asher and Anna Carteret, and David Suchet in the title role.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel promised the chaos of her personal life was all in the past, but she is conflicted upon discovering her mother's new boyfriend is a violent domestic abuser. Meanwhile, Janet gets cold feet when she goes on her first date, terrified at the idea of having to impress a stranger. The crimebusters are united in the search for the killer of Rich Hutchings, who is found murdered in the flat he shares with his husband Adam. Barry, their outspoken and violent homophobic neighbour, is the prime suspect. However, as Adam's friend Tim struggles to recall the events of their night out, it seems Barry may be in the clear. Meanwhile, Rachel is horrified when her mum Sharon turns up asking for help. Crime drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp and Danny Miller.(n)

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: As Syndicate 9 investigates the discovery of a woman's body in a Manchester hotel room, Gill introduces Rachel to high-flying DS Will Pemberton, unaware they are already well acquainted - they've been having a passionate, secret relationship for months. But while the volatile copper can be discreet when it comes to romance, will she be able to hide her feelings when Gill lets slip that she wasn't the first choice for the sergeant's job? Meanwhile, Janet is keen to give her own love life a boost, especially after seeing how happy Ade is with his new partner Eleanor. However, a speed-dating event might not be the best option, as Janet finds herself treating each brief encounter like a police interrogation. Crime drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp, Amelia Bullmore, Steve Touissant and Mina Anwar.(n)

programme.title: Little Boy Blue
programme.desc: Mercer and his associates are tried for their roles in the killing of 11-year-old Rhys Jones, but the verdict fails to bring closure for the boy's parents Melanie and Steve as the fractures in their relationship come to a head. Meanwhile an unexpected setback leaves Det Supt Dave Kelly with a tough decision to make. The concluding part of the fact-based drama centred on the devastating impact of a child's murder amid a wave of gang violence in Liverpool, starring Stephen Graham, Sinead Keenan and Brian F O'Byrne. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Kendal and Andy Strong first visited Lanzarote 10 years ago and a recent trip back and a particularly beautiful sunset re-ignited their love for the island. Now the pair are determined to buy their very own holiday home, so armed with a budget of £75,000, Jonnie Irwin shows them five potential properties, including some away from their favourite spot of Playa Blanca.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: The Caribbean island of Nevis is very close to Steven and Murila Fifer's hearts. Murila was born there, and the couple have visited the place together many times over the years. They have now decided their dream holiday home should be on the island, so Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties within their £330,000 budget. Will they fall for a country villa or a beach-side home?.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is Nateby Inn in Cumbria, where landlady Gaynor Walker is ready with a warm welcome. A trip to Gaynor's local brewery turns out to be a barrel of laughs when one guest beats another in a cask-rolling competition, before a broken cooker creates chaos in the kitchen the following morning.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners visit the Outfields Farm Bed and Breakfast in Ravensden, Bedfordshire, on their second stay, where proprietors Graham and Julia Ashley treat them to an afternoon of indoor sky-diving before hosting a dinner filled with surprises. The guests enjoy a good night's sleep, but one of the owners is expecting hassle at breakfast time.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to At Home in Chiswick, west London, where artist Bob Osbourne appears to take a rather laid-back approach to running his B&B. On arrival, guests are pleasantly surprised by their first impressions of the communal living space-come-mini art gallery - but it's not long before they are dishing the dirt.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition draws to a close at the Ammonite Lodge guesthouse in Chard, Somerset, where owners Andrew and Clare Ashmore hope to excite their guests with a game of skittles. During the final dinner of the week, the competitors discuss their first impressions of each other, and Bob and Julia share some amusing observations with the group.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners confront their critics face to face, and the winners are announced. Nateby Inn host Gaynor takes issue with Graham and Julia's reduced marks for cobwebs. The conversation becomes heated when Outfields Farm's owners tackle Gaynor's complaints in return, and Georgie jumps to their defence. Artist Bob Osborne has a long list of grievances he wants to address, and Julia is left cringing when her previous comments rebound on her.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: B&B operators Linda and Mike are looking for a holiday home to use as a winter retreat while their business is closed. Linda fell in love with Antigua 20 years ago and is taking Mike along for the first time on a property-finding mission. Scarlette Douglas shows the couple five potential properties within their £260,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Childhood sweethearts Colin and Alison Jenkins search for a home in Barbados with a budget of £275,000 budget on the island's lively south coast.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Property magnate Paul Whight invites Tony Robinson and the team to investigate his stately home in Essex to learn more about the De Veres, better known as the Earls of Oxford, who once lived there. In an in-depth search of the building and garden, the archaeologists gradually make discoveries that shed light on the history of the home and the aristocratic family.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and a team of specialist historians travel to Nottinghamshire, where residents of Clipstone village near Sherwood Forest believe some impressive ruins in a farmer's field may have played a part in the ancient tales of Robin Hood and Bad King John. The extensive building records and high-quality carvings prove a fine building existed somewhere nearby, but finding out what it looked like and how large it was frustrates the archaeologists.(n)

programme.title: World's Weirdest Homes
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton presents a guide to 20 of the most unusual residences ever built, before revealing what he considers the weirdest house on Earth. Residences featured include a skip that provides living space for an artist, a rotating house, a plane in the middle of a forest, a converted nuclear missile silo, a perfect replica of the family home from The Munsters, a house shaped like a giant beagle, a summerhouse by a frequently flooding river and an apartment block that looks like a giant snake.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: Switzerland v France.
programme.desc: Switzerland v France (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the concluding match in Group C for both sides. France were quarter-finalists when the competition was last held four years ago and will be expecting to progress, while this is the first time Switzerland have qualified for the competition. Followed by highlights of Austria v Iceland.(n)

programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, as Jon Richardson and Jayde Adams compete against Sean Lock and Joe Wilkinson. programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, as Jon Richardson and David Mitchell take on guest captain Joe Wilkinson and Roisin Conaty. programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits California, where his job is to help the owner of Lido Di Manhattan. The chef tries to teach her the basics of cooking and venue management, but trouble brews when her staff threaten to walk out on relaunch night.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by Dragons' Den panellist Kelly Hoppen, Olympic gymnast Louis Smith and comedians Henning Wehn and David O'Doherty to discuss and dissect the events that set the British public's chins wagging over the past week. Jimmy Carr hosts the irreverent panel show.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps a couple from a West Yorkshire village with a love of travelling to find a perfect retirement home on the south coast of Barbados, on a budget of £275,000.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another selection of B&B owners take it in turns as hosts to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money. The contest begins at Ian and Sam Sugden's Abbey House in Penrith, Cumbria, where the guests are impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms. However, there is some grumbling over breakfast about the bacon.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners stay at Compton House in Newark, Nottinghamshire, which is run by Lisa Holloway - who prides herself on providing a home away from home for her visitors. However, some of the guests have issues with dust and the haddock served at breakfast - and challenge whether a night's stay is worth the price tag.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave and Jo Bate welcome their guests to the White Horse, a pub and B&B in Ripon, North Yorkshire, where they hope an afternoon of morris dancing in front of the cathedral will make a lasting impression. Unfortunately, Ed and Jane Mitchell get locked inside their room by mistake, and there are arguments over tomatoes at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Retired teachers Ed and Jane Mitchell welcome the contestants to the Old Farmhouse, Cheshire, but everyone is shocked to discover they will have to share a bathroom. Meanwhile, Sam and Ian Sugden find an unwelcome surprise underneath their bed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment day arrives, as the guests gather to find out who has won and to thrash out their differences - from some fishy findings to a reminder of why sorry can be the hardest word. Later on, a heated exchange about cleaning ends in tears.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Su and Reg Roberts from south Wales first fell in love with Tobago 20 years ago and have been back every other year since. Now, with their children growing up and retirement approaching, they're ready to turn their dream of a holiday home on the island into a reality. Presenter Scarlette Douglas shows them five properties within their £310,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: With their children now leading independent lives, Kevin and Monique Dixon want to buy a holiday home on Florida's Gulf Coast, where they can enjoy the sailing and outdoor life as the UK winters begin back home. With £285,000 to spend, presenter Ben Hillman shows them five waterside homes.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson adjudicates a debate to decide the team's greatest discovery to date. With more than 250 digs to consider, many of which retrieved rare and valuable finds in addition to the ones that revealed intriguing archaeological fakery, Mick Aston, Phil Harding and Helen Geake discuss and defend their favourites.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: The Time Team Guide to Burial.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team revisit ancient burial sites around the country, including Bronze Age cemeteries, Roman mausoleums and decorative Anglo-Saxon resting places to reveal how funeral customs have developed and evolved over thousands of years of British history.(n)

programme.title: Guy Martin's Spitfire
programme.desc: In May 1940, a Mark 1 Spitfire was shot down and crash-landed on a beach in northern France, where it slowly sank into the sand. The wreckage was finally recovered in the 1980s and stored in France for more than 20 years. In this programme, motorcycle racer and mechanic Guy Martin joins a two-year project to rebuild the aeroplane, revealing the engineering and skills involved, and providing a fitting homage to the bravery of everyone involved in its service.(n)

programme.title: UEFA Euro 2017 Live
programme.sub-title: UEFA Women's Euro 2017: Scotland v Spain.
programme.desc: Scotland v Spain (Kick-off 7.45pm). Plus, highlights of Portugal v England. Lee McKenzie presents, with commentary by Robyn Cowen and Scott Booth.(n)

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Claire goes out with Dougal as he collects rent from the tenants, and to her horror, he uses Jamie's scars to gain sympathy for the Jacobite cause. Meanwhile, the nurse realises that a key moment in Scottish history is fast approaching. Period drama, starring Caitriona Balfe, Graham McTavish and Sam Heughan.(n)

programme.desc: Women Behind Bars. California's Valley State Prison has all the hallmarks of maximum security: violent inmates, overcrowding, and a heavy drug trade. It is the population that makes it unique. The inmates at Valley State are all women. And with some 3,900 female offenders, it is one of the world's largest women's prisons. Homemade weapons made with materials like screws and a lighter become a fatal stabbing device. Survival at Valley State Prison for Women means manoeuvring(n)

programme.title: When Sharks Attack

programme.title: Planet Carnivore
programme.desc: Great White Shark. In South Africa's False Bay, mornings are action-packed - and bloody. That's when Haai, a huge, female great white shark, hunts for Cape fur seals. The seals themselves leave their rocky island to fish in what locals think of as The Gauntlet. Closer to shore, a family of African penguins is raising their chicks - and timing their fishing to when the fur seals are absent. Unfortunately, lately Haai has been having trouble catching the seals. Despite her superb senses and incredible weaponry, she's gotten so big that she can't maneuver as well as she used to. Great whites tend to target specific animals as their prey - then they concentrate all two tons and twenty feet of power on catching, killing, and eating the individual seal. Haai has chosen a young fur seal, for her next meal -- we'll call him Rob, the Afrikaans word for seal. But Rob is elusive - and disinclined to play along with the usual routine - and the two intelligent, determined creatures enter into a daily contest of wits and abilities. Meantime, the entire neighborhood is about to be hit with a mighty blow. Something in the open ocean is growing bigger - and it is headed for Haai's neighborhood. It will be a huge benefit for many - but it will also be the ultimate problem for the white shark -- and for Rob, her seal prey. Once a year, the new crop of sardines begins a migration back to their birthplace - and they have to pass False Bay in order to get there. Sardines follow the coldest currents, and in the Gauntlet, the cold seawater ribbon gets narrow and close to shore. It's an open invitation to every predator on the South African sea coast - and they all arrive, feasting on the confused sardines. Tiger sharks, bottlenose dolphins, gannets and other marine predators all follow the sardines for the week or so that it takes the little fish to realize they've made a big mistake. When they do, the bait balls of silver snacks suddenly vanish back into the deep blue sea - leaving frustrated, still hungry, seals, penguins, sharks and countless others. This year, several young great whites have also been following the sardine run to False Bay. Great whites live on fish when they're small, and graduate to marine mammals - like Cape fur seals - when they transition to adulthood. Now, these newcomers are searching for the perfect place to do just that, and they're going to..(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Strip Strangler. The "signature killer," who has been plaguing the CSI by leaving behind frustratingly tiny bits of evidence at each crime scene, strikes again. Grissom (William L. Petersen) is more convinced than ever that the elusive killer has a working knowledge of forensic procedure -- even to the point of planting contrary evidence that he (or she) knows will be dismissed. As if Grissom doesn't have enough trouble, the FBI insists upon taking over the investigation -- with CSI unit member Sara (Jorja Fox) as bait for the murderer. This was the final episode of CSI's first season(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Burked. Grissom and crew investigate the drug-related death of a popular casino executive who was found dead in his house, the victim of an apparent overdose(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Chaos Theory. Drama series about a team of forensic investigators in Las Vegas. A college student disappears from her dorm room without signs of a struggle, after booking a cab and a flight home. The CSIs find themselves fishing in a sea of red herrings when they are confronted with a series of false leads(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Overload. After Grissom finds evidence to suggest an alleged suicide victim was deliberately electrocuted, he, Warwick and Sara search a building site for more clues. Meanwhile, Catherine and Nick are called to the scene when a psychiatrist reports that one of her young patients died from an epileptic seizure(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Bully for You. A cocky teen football player is fatally shot in a high-school bathroom and the evidence seems to implicate a student who was tormented by the player. Also, a body that has turned to human soup is found in a bag dumped in a gully(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Scuba Doobie-Doo. Grissom scours an apartment with blood-sprayed walls but finds no body, while Catherine and Nick try to determine how a dead scuba diver ended up in a tree. (Season 2, episode 5)(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Alter Boys. A young man is discovered burying a body that has been shot three times, but Grissom isn't convinced the guy is the killer---despite a wealth of evidence to the contrary; a woman is found dead in a health spa locker room without obvious evidence of foul play, but Catherine and Nick suspect murder. Grissom: William Petersen. Catherine: Marg Helgenberger. Nick: George Eads(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Caged. The CSI team investigate the murder of a rare-book restorer whose death was witnessed by a young autistic librarian with whom she worked. And Sarah and Catherine are called in to examine the events leading up to a tragic collision between an SUV and a train(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Slaves of Las Vegas. The CSI team investigates when a young woman's nude body is found partially buried in a sandbox. The victim is identified as a worker in a fetish club, but the club's owner admits the woman used to freelance as a submissive. Sara and Warrick look into a shooting and robbery that seems to be an inside job(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: And Then There Were None. The CSI team investigate a robbery at a casino which appears to have been perpetrated by a female gang, with one of the gang members left dead. Meanwhile, Sara and Catherine investigate a convenience store homicide in a rural mining town and uncover some evidence that links the felony with the casino job(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Ellie. Warrick is in charge for the night and has to contend with a murder that may involve Brass's estranged daughter, who is apparently part of a drug ring. Meanwhile, Sara tries to prove that a couple of holiday makers are really counterfeiters(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Hiatus. The team tries to prevent a terrorist bombing targeting the Navy, while Gibbs, still recovering from his injury, suffers memory loss(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Shalom. Ziva's past comes back to haunt her when she witnesses an assassination by her former Mossad partner. Convinced her father ordered the hit, Ziva seeks refuge at the Israeli Embassy only to find she is wanted by the FBI. As the NCIS team, now headed by Tony, works to prove her innocence, Ziva reaches out to the one person she has always been able to trust(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Escaped. Gibbs is temporarily reinstated as an agent when a convict (Brandon Barash) whom Gibbs and Fornell put away escapes and becomes a threat to Fornell and his young daughter. Mickey Stokes: Hal Holbrook. Gary Silverstin: Courtney Gains. Stanley Springer: Wayne Pere(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Singled Out. An abandoned car, registered to a missing navy lieutenant, is found full of blood. The NCIS team learns that the missing lieutenant was profiling men, trying to find a perfect man for herself. When they find out that the woman intended to go to a seminar at a local hotel, Ziva goes undercover to find more information. Ducky gets to work on profiling the men, while Jenny makes a secret offer to Tony(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Faking It. A former Soviet soldier is the number one suspect as Gibbs and his crew investigate a murder(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Dead and Unburied. NCIS (Naval Criminal Investigative Service) is more than just an action drama. With liberal doses of humour, it's a show that focuses on the sometimes complex and always amusing dynamics of a team forced to work together in high stress situations. Leading this troupe of colourful personalities is NCIS Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs, a former Marine gunnery sergeant, whose skills as an investigator are unmatched(n)

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. programme.title: The Flash

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Hetty is worried about Deeks and Sam's state of mind, so she calls in psychologist Nate Getz to help them move on from their torture ordeal. But things don't get off to a good start when Oliver tells the speedster that he still has a lot to learn - and the friends become foes when Bivolo intervenes, sending an annoyed Flash on a rage-fuelled rampage.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong.(n)
